dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From high above, we look straight down a FOREST OF TOWERI PINES standing in a field of moonlit snow. We glide over the treetops, floating just above their pea as a light snow falls, the flakes corkscrewing lazily awa All seems peaceful, silent. Then we notice a strange light playing against the fresh powder. Red, then blue. Then red again. We crest a final stand of trees to reveal: AN ENTIRE ENCAMPMENT OF LAW ENFORCEMENT, some three hundred or so police, fire and ambulance, situated in what appears to b the middle of nowhere. From this angle, directly overhead, the SQUAD CARS and SW VANS almost look like toys. Nothing moves. The POLICE OFFICERS and SWAT Team members, hunkered down in firing positions, point their weapons at something unseen. We tilt from our isolating top-down view to reveal that t paramilitary phalanx is surrounding: a MODEST FARMHOUSE. It's a standoff of some kind, clearly. Then we see an ANT-SIZED FIGURE moving urgently across th frozen tableau. We slowly zoom in on the ant, revealing h to be a MAN IN A WINDBREAKER. We move with him now, tracking a FOLDED NOTE that he carr in his hand, as he brings us to a TACTICAL TRAILER with a seal emblazoned on the door:

dialogues.speaker: HOSTAGE RESCUE TEAM
dialogues.text: The Windbreaker Man enters and we go with him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...moving through the narrow trailer, past HIGH-TECH OBSERVATION EQUIPMENT manned by SPECIALISTS, to a BACK DO The Windbreaker Man opens the door to reveal a

dialogues.speaker: SMALL COMMS ROOM
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and a NEGOTIATOR on the phone, flanked by the HOSTAGE RES COMMANDER ("HR1i") and the ON SCENE COMMANDER, the man running the show. The Windbreaker Man hands the On Scene the folded note. H reads it and nods. Meanwhile, the Negotiator works the phone in a last ditch attempt to talk this through... -.-yes, I do. And I

dialogues.speaker: NEGOTIATOR
dialogues.text: hear what you're saying. I would be angry too. But you have to listen to me now. This has gone on long enough and it needs to end, okay? Can you help me here? Help me find a solution so we can end this peacefully for you, for your family, for everyone. We don't want anyone to get hurt -- and I know you don't want to hurt anyone. (beat) Ray? Ray?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clutching the phone to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: his ear is RAY HUTCHINSON (38), bearded, muscled and looking like he hasn't slept in days

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: You don't want to hurt anyone? I'm already hurt. You hear me? I'm already hurt. (beat) You say you're giving me a choice but this isn't a choice. Ending this peacefully means I go to prison and my wife and my kids grow up without a father? me? That's what you're offering (beat, deciding) I want everyone gone. You and your men, and the snipers too, all of "em -- gone. I don't see tail lights in the next five minutes, I'll end things my Ray hangs up and turns FRIGHTENED FAMILY: his old SON. All three of counter, backs pressed way. away from us, revealing his WIFE, his DAUGHTER and his six year- them hunkered down below the kitchen against the cabinet doors. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAY (cont'd) It's alright. Everything's gonna be alright now. I promise. Ray moves to a HEAVY CHEST and throws it open, staring at what's inside. A grim look washes over his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Negotiator looks up gravely from dial tone in his han The On Scene looks to HR1.

dialogues.speaker: HR1
dialogues.text: Gold Unit is in position. They have compromise authority and are at ready green. We're set, sir.

dialogues.speaker: ON SCENE
dialogues.text: (re: the note) 7th floor approves escalation. (to the Negotiator) Can you get him back on the phone?

dialogues.speaker: NEGOTIATOR
dialogues.text: He's done talking.

dialogues.speaker: ON SCENE
dialogues.text: (beat) Very well. The On Scene exits the COMMS ROOM and moves into the main trailer where he picks up a headset. ON SCENE (cont'd) Gold Unit, this is "Tock", be advised you have control. Repeat, you have control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The REFLECTION in the farmhouse window shows SWAT UNITS backing off. Ray's request, it seems, has been met. The window curtains crack to reveal Ray watching the acti We drop down from the window and pivot off of Ray to reve THE FARMHOUSE YARD. A blanket of snow, some bushes, a woodpile. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hold on this frame -- but nothing happens. A moment more. Still nothing. Then... One of the BUSHES moves. Then part of a WOODPILE seems to detach. And a section of snow right in front of us this whole time, rises revealing itself to have GREEN EYES. And now we see it: a SIX-MAN FBI HRT ASSAULT TEAM moves f their camouflaged hides and stacks up tight against the w just below the farmhouse window. They slough off their elaborate camouflage, revealing eac man to be kitted out in body armor and loaded for bear. We land on the team leader, WILL FORD, a seasoned operato Will speaks softly into his comm...

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Gold Unit in position. Will looks at his second in command, his best friend and man we'll know later as HORACE. Will nods. Horace moves, setting a heavy-duty BREACHING CHARGE on the farmhouse wa Finished, Horace slides back into position giving Will th thumbs up. Will nods and begins the countdown... WILL (cont'd) Five, four, three, two, one... Execute. Execute. Execute. Will depresses a THUMB PLUNGER, igniting the breaching charge -- BANG! The sound is deafening as the wall explod leaving a gaping hole of smoke and dust in its wake. Will rushes in, primary through the door. We go with him, pushing through the thick haze to find

dialogues.speaker: RAY HUTCHINSON
dialogues.text: standing there, his back to us. Will and Horace go to gun on him, their sites leveled, fingers poised on triggers. WILL (cont'd) Turn around! Show us your hands!

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: Do it! Now! The rest of the HRT UNIT fans out near Will, securing the mother and daughter who won't stop screaming. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly, Ray turns to face Will revealing that he's HOLDIN HIS SIX YEAR-OLD SON in his arms -- the boy's head wedged into the crook of his father's neck. HORACE (cont'd) Boss...

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Hold your fire. (to Ray) Put him down. Ray hesitates. Horace grips his M-4, staring down it.

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: +..-I've got him clean... The boy's eyes lock with Will's.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: No. Don't. I got this. Will turns to Ray, speaking with authoritative calm... WILL (cont'd) Ray, look at me. Look at me. It's over now. It's over. Put your son down, get on your knees and interlace your fingers behind your head. Do it now. Ray takes it all in, the madness he's caused. The pain.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Ray lets his son slide off of him to the ground, revealin something horrifying: RAY IS WEARING A SUICIDE VEST. Will's eyes go wide -- he dives for Horace, tackling him behind the KITCHEN COUNTER just as: THE VEST DETONATES. boom. A ring of tinnitus in our ear. Screaming. Will, disoriented, catches glimpses of his team shattered -- de or dying. A living nightmare. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The horror of it washes over Will: his call to hold fire cost the lives of those he cares about most in this world his team, his men, his brothers. Devastated, Will mumbles over and over...

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: No-no-no-no... Sound falls away. Everything goes to white. We're in a hallway now somehow. The strobe of overhead florescent lights rushing past us. Then a face looks down at us. A Naval surgeon we'll come know as SARAH. She smiles at us and says...

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You're gonna be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sun-dappled city park. Green grass. Trees. A little creek babbles nearby. Two kids, seven year-old fraternal twins, HENRY and GEORGIA argue about what to play: hide & seek or tag. Georgia gets her way: they'll play tag. We find Will, older now, a sadness behind his eyes. But sitting on the grass watching the children play, he can't help but smile.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: She takes after you, you know. Will turns to see his beautiful wife, Sarah, the surgeon saved his life, enjoying the moment with him.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: You think?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. Stubborn. Too hard on herself. Cries during sports movies.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: I don't cry during sports movies. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will laughs.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Rudy.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Well, come on. It's Rudy.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Field of Dreams.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Everyone cries at Field of Dreams--

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: A League of Their Own.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: That was one time. And I was on medication.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Benedryl.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Extra strength -- and fine, maybe she's got my personality. I'm just glad she got your looks.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Me too because you'd make a really ugly woman. Like if we put a dress on you, the only thing missing would be neck-bolts.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Hang on -- back up. Did you call me stubborn?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You are stubborn.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Since when?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Since always. Now say it.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Come on. I got it.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Then let me hear you say it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Who's being stubborn now?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I'm being insistent. There's a difference. Besides, don't you want to make a good impression?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Not really.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I'm serious, Will. It'll go a long way with him -- it's a cultural thing. Just say it.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Fine. (beat) Hen gaoxing de wen ni. It's Cantonese. And it actually wasn't that bad...

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: That's great.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Perfect. Perfectly done. The intonation, the enunciation. A+.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Thank you. See? I'm not stubborn. I can be taught.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: One thing though.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I taught you how to say: Hou hoi sam sik dou nei, "It's an honor to meet you." But you said, "Hou hoi sam sek dou nei."

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: And what does that mean? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: It's an honor to kiss you.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Ah. And that's bad?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Depends on what kind of meeting you wanna have.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Alright -- I give up. No more Chinese. I've gotta get ready. Will stands up calling out to the kids... WILL (cont'd) Henry! Georgia! Time to go! The kids look at their father. Georgia capitalizes on the distraction, tagging her twin brother...

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIA
dialogues.text: Tag! You're it! ...then bolting. Henry cries foul and gives chase. The tw kids run toward their father with abandon. Will smiles. Georgia reaches Will first, wrapping her arms around her father's leg... GEORGIA (cont'd) Base! Dad's base! I'm safe! ...and that's when we see that Will's right leg isn't mad of flesh and bone but rather metal and plastic -- a PROSTHESIS FROM THE KNEE DOWN. A scar he bears from that fateful night ten years ago. Henry arrives grabbing hold of Will's other leg.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Safe!

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIA
dialogues.text: I'm already safe, you can't be safe too.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Yes I can.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIA
dialogues.text: That's stupid. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Hey -- not nice. And your brother's right. You're both safe. Daddy is safe for everyone because-- WHOA! -- suddenly Will jumps a foot as Sarah dumps an entire bottle of water down his back.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Tag you're it! Sarah takes off running, laughing. Will gives chase, his kids squealing with delight at their parents playing. Will catches Sarah, planting a big kiss on her before she tickles him and trips him to the ground, falling on top o him as both Henry and Georgia join in: a dog pile on dadd Will lets himself get pinned, laughing -- in heaven. It's then that we PULL BACK from this idyllic familial scene, past the grass and the trees and the babbling broo We continue pulling back, further and further still, unti we reveal something shocking. This park isn't in a city. And it's not in a small town. This entire THREE ACRE PARK exists on the 100TH FLOOR OF TALLEST BUILDING IN THE WORLD. A newly completed, three-thousand foot tall work of stunn architecture called THE PEARL rises gracefully from shoreline of VICTORIA HARBOR, dwarfing the surrounding skyline. We're in... Hong Kong Then a SOOTHING VOICE...

dialogues.speaker: SOOTHING VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Welcome to The Pearl... Quickly, we find ourselves in a highly polished PROMOTION VIDEO...

dialogues.speaker: SOOTHING VOICE
dialogues.text: +..a marvel of modern engineering. Standing at over three-thousand feet, The Pearl's 225 stories make it the world's tallest building... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: We get our first good look at this work of art: a TOWERIN TWISTING, SKYSCRAPER with an OPEN-AIR CENTER CORE running its entire length, from top to bottom, giving the structu an airy, sunlit translucent grandeur. SOOTHING VOICE (cont'd) ...it's so tall, you could fit the Empire State building inside of it twice! And you'd still have room for a 50 story building on top! -- B-roll of construction and slick computer generated fl through designs fill the frame. SOOTHING VOICE (cont'd) Completed just last year, China's newest beacon of progress boasts a five-star hotel, three full gyms, two 16-screen cinemas, a driving range, as well as world-class shopping and dining at its six-story indoor mall and three star Michelin-rated restaurant with rotating views of the spectacular Hong Kong skyline -- all within its confines... -- we see cutaways of each feature, happy people enjoying every amenity. SOOTHING VOICE (cont'd) ...And that's just half the story! A DIVIDING LINE bisects the building halfway up... SOOTHING VOICE (cont'd) Next month, The Pearl will open its upper half to permanent residents -- already sold out, with a ten year waiting list, these luxury apartments will serve as home to many of China's most successful citizens. With Pangu Park -- the world's first fully functional high rise garden -- located on the hundredth floor, residents will have their every possible need met, from outdoor sun to indoor fun -- you'll never need to leave The Pearl! It's then we PULL BACK to reveal we're...  12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stunning three-bedroom apartment on the 98th floor with jaw-dropping views. Henry and Georgia are transfixed by t television playing the promotional video...

dialogues.speaker: SOOTHING VOICE
dialogues.text: But that's not all. The Pearl's crowning achievement -- the singular feature that makes this building unlike any other, anywhere else in the world is... ..-but just before we reveal what that might be, the TV c off. Henry and Georgia turn to see Sarah standing there.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: TV goes off, shoes on. It's Panda Time! Excited, Georgia zips up her PANDA HOODIE, pulling the co over her head, turning her into a mini-Panda bear. SARAH (cont'd) Nice, Georgia. Subtle. (beat) Where's your dad?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIA
dialogues.text: He's talking to himself again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dressed nicely, Will ties the laces on his BROWN WINGTIP. Only the shoe is facing him on the bathroom sink counter, attached to his PROSTHETIC LEG -- a handy way to do it. He talks to himself in the mirror as he goes, practicing Chinese phrase over and over, stumbling every time. Will shakes his head muttering to himself...

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Screw it. I'm just gonna high-five the guy. Finished tying his shoe, Will uses a Kleenex to wipe off smudge on it, then tosses the tissue paper into the toile (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Will attaches his prosthesis, sliding his pant leg down o it. He goes to flush the toilet but can't find the handle -- there doesn't seem to be one. It's a mystery. Will looks at a BIZARRE ARRAY of touchscreen buttons next the toilet -- none of which look like "flush". He presses one and gets a BIDET SPRAY right in the kisser. One cue, Sarah walks in.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Everything okay in here?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Yep, just thought I'd take a shower in the toilet. Sarah walks over... WILL (cont'd) It's broken. We should call-- .В»..and presses a button, the toilet flushes normally. WILL (cont'd) I was gonna pick that one next.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Sure you were, big guy. Sarah fixes Will's outfit, drying him off, fussing over h SARAH (cont'd) Hey -- you think it's weird that we're the only ones on this floor?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: We're the only ones on any floor from the 96th on up -- so not really.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: No, I mean why not put us up in the hotel in the bottom half? Why give us an entire ghost town floor to ourselves?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: I don't know -- maybe he's trying to impress us.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You think a billionaire, real estate tycoon is trying to impress us? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: You think I'm reaching?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I think you drive a Kia. So, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: I'm just saying: don't over-think it.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Have you met me? Will smiles, grabs his jacket, closes his LAPTOP and puts in his SHOULDER BAG. SARAH (cont'd) Horace is coming to get you?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Any minute now.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Can I just say one thing?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: I doubt it.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Don't give him any money.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: He's not going to ask me for money.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Because he's head of security for this entire building and they pay him for that. Will and Sarah move into the other room and tag-team gett Georgia and Henry ready, backpacks, shoes, etc. Will puts Georgia's hair into a ponytail, clearly he's had practice

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: And how much of that does he double down with? Will frowns. Moves toward the front door, Sarah follows. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: That's not -- he doesn't have a gambling problem.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Not anymore -- you helped him.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Look, that was three years ago -- he got in over his head with the wrong kind of people. He would've done the same thing for me. He made a mistake -- we all make mistakes. (beat) And he's sticking his neck out for me. They could've gone with a higher profile guy to handle the security assessment but he put in a good word. He's the reason we're here -- and we could use the money.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You have a soft spot for him. That's all I'm saying. DING-DONG. Doorbell. They look at each other -- time's up SARAH (cont'd) You're a big dummy. You know that?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: You married me.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I'm a sucker for handsome. Sue me.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Love you.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Love you too, neck-bolts. Will laughs. They kiss. The kids go, "Ewww". Will looks at his twins...

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Okay team, daddy's gotta go make the bacon. But let me ask you one thing before I go... Will points to Henry. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: WILL (cont'd) Daddy loves who?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Me! Will points to Georgia...

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Daddy loves who?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIA
dialogues.text: Me! Will rapidly points between them repeating his question, each time they shout out, "Me!" at the top of their lungs Finally, Will kisses each of them on the tops of their heads. Sarah watches the sweet moment, sighing...

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I gotta get a chant. Will winks at her, then moves to the door, opening it to reveal Horace his second-in-command from his HRT days and the only other member of the team to survive the blast. Nearly Will's size, with some telltale BURN SCARS on his cheek and neck, Horace offers up a big smile.

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: Brother.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Brother. The two friends embrace. The observant might notice Horace's right hand is severely misinformed -- mangled fr the explosion. The hug breaks and Horace spots Sarah...

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: Sarah -- you look beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Nice to see you, Horace. Sarah gives Horace a polite hug just as Henry and Georgia arrive. Horace can't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: These are the twins? Wow -- are they driving yet? You guys remember your Uncle Horace? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIA
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: We're going to see the pandas.

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: Yes -- I heard. That's why I got you guys a little something. Horace pulls out a trio of GOLD TICKETS. HORACE (cont'd) These'll let you stay for the nighttime feeding -- after they close Ocean Park to everyone else. Very hard to get. He hands the tickets to Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: That's amazing. Thank you, H.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What do you guys say?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Georgia?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIA
dialogues.text: Are you gonna ask my dad for money? Off of Will's look we move to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horace and Will move toward the cylindrical INNER ATRIUM The Pearl, an open-air center column that runs from the ground floor to the very top of the structure. The internal circumference is lined with a series of GLAS ELEVATORS and SKYWAY BRIDGES that span the vast opening, connecting various floors directly, giving the space the of a BRAIN STEM with synapses firing. Horace jabs the button, they wait. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Sorry about that. Georgia doesn't have a filter. Sarah thinks she takes after me.

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: Why, does she cry at sports movies too? DING. Elevator arrives. Horace and Will step on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This GLASS ELEVATOR travels up the INNER ATRIUM -- a sphincter-clenching ride if you're afraid of heights. Will looks through the glass: elevators rise and fall, gleaming in natural sunlight. He marvels...

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: You hear that? Horace strains an ear. Shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: I don't hear anything.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Exactly. These are mag-lev elevators They work on magnetic induction -- like the bullet trains in Japan, only vertical. No cables, no wires, nothing. No one's ever built any that go this high. It's bleeding edge stuff.

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: Huh. No kidding.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: How do you not know that?

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: They hired me to protect it, not give tours. But lemme guess: you spent the last six months studying every nut, bolt and blueprint of this damn place. Will looks away. Horace knows him too well. He teases... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: HORACE (cont'd) Come on, tell me I'm wrong.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: You're wrong. (beat) It was eight months. Horace shakes his head...

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: You know he's not gonna ask you to build the thing from scratch, right?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: I like details.

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: Nerd. Will chuckles. HORACE (cont'd) Hey -- you hear they switched insurance guys on you?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: No Singh?

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: No Singh. Singh go bye-bye.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Huh. They say why?

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: Official word, he got sick. Unofficial word, he got sick of the boss man's speeches.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: He gives speeches?

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: You ever met a billionaire who doesn't?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: I've never met a billionaire.

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: Well stick around, this is China -- we got a million of 'em. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ding. The elevator doors open. They step off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horace leads Will across an opulent, sunlit private floor stopping at a pair of imposing DOUBLE DOORS.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: (re: the doors) Wow -- those are them, right? The titanium doors from the blueprints?

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: Nothing says welcome to my penthouse panic room better than ten inches of military-grade super alloy.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Subtle. Horace holds his hand against a wall-mounted scanner.

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: Ready to meet Oz? The double doors swing open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horace leads Will past the foot-thick Titanium doors into penthouse to end all penthouses. Three floors, exquisitely designed, impeccably furnished offering up staggering panoramic views. This palace in th sky is fit not for a king, but a Pharaoh. Will takes it in...

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: I mean, I guess if you gotta live somewhere...

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: Right? Will notices a framed BLACK BELT and ceremonial CHINESE SWORD on the wall next to him.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: He's a black belt? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: In the same way Doctor Dre is a doctor. Heard he built them a brand new dojo after he "earned" it.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Hey -- Sarah thinks I should doa Chinese thing when I meet him.

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: Chinese thing?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Like say some words. A greeting.

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: In Chinese?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Cantonese. But yeah. You know, to show respect.

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: I wouldn't.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: Because you suck at languages and you'll probably mess it up and embarrass yourself.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: But other than that?

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Mr. Ford. The moment interrupted, Will and Horace turn to see ZHAO (30s), a Chinese Elon Musk and the dashing visionary behi The Pearl, come gliding down a staircase toward them flan by a handful of SUITS and a discrete PRIVATE SECURITY DET

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: It's a pleasure to meet you. Zhao speaks nearly perfect English, a hallmark of his Oxf education. says... They shake hands. Will glances at Horace then

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Hou hot sam sik dou nei. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Will nailed it. Zhao smiles, impressed. Horace is slack- jawed. Zhao rattles off a response in rapid-fire Cantones Finished, the billionaire waits expectantly on Will to answer. Will, of course, has no idea what Zhao just said. A pregnant pause, then Zhao lets him off the hook...

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: I'm kidding. Will exhales.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Oh, thank god. My wife only taught me one phrase.

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: Sarah, right?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: And your children, Henry and Georgia -- twins?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: You do your research.

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: I've got a good team around me. But I wasn't aware that your wife speaks Cantonese. I thought she was a Naval surgeon.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: She is. But she minored in language and East Asian studies at Annapolis. She was gonna work for Doctors Without Borders in rural China after her service.

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: She met someone who needed her more. Zhao smiles. Just then, a stuffy British pencil-pusher, M PIERCE interrupts the moment. Zhao pivots to him warmly. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: Mr. Ford, allow me to introduce Mr. Pierce from the Hawthorne/Stone Insurance Group, the company lucky enough to underwrite The Pearl. Mr. Pierce smiles thinly, extending his hand.

dialogues.speaker: MR. PIERCE
dialogues.text: A pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Likewise.

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: Mr. Singh is ill.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: I heard.

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: At any rate, I hope your family is enjoying their stay in Hong Kong.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: We've got the whole floor to ourselves -- what's not to love?

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: Sorry if I went a little overboard -- I guess I was trying to impress you. (beat) Shall we begin? Zhao motions and the group moves off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zhao stands in front of a WALL-SIZED TOUCH SCREEN which displays a 3D rendering of The Pearl. Zhao rotates and resizes the display as he speaks. Will sits with his laptop open, Horace next to him. Opposite them, the THREE SUITS and Mr. Pierce.

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: ...with our cutting edge solar arrays and proprietary wind-harnessing technology, The Pearl has a negative environmental footprint -- even at full occupancy, we'll actually give power back to the city. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

ZHAO (cont'd) (beat) The residential upper half, with our 24-hour surveillance & security, redundant off-site fire control systems, and on-site emergency medical staff, will be the safest, most luxurious living in all of China, if not the world. We even have our very own dedicated cell tower -- so you'll never miss a call even when you're a mile in the air. (beat) The Pearl is not just the future of China but it is, in a very real sense, The Future itself. The suits clap like ass-kissers. Annoyed, Zhao waves at them to cease. He looks to Will... ZHAO (cont'd) What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Me?

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: Yes, of course. Unsure of the politics of how to respond, Will goes with.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: It's, uh, neat.

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: Neat?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Yeah, real neat. Mr. Pierce jumps in... Sick burn.

dialogues.speaker: MR. PIERCE
dialogues.text: I think what Mr. Ford is trying to say is that it would be imprudent of someone in his position to make any comment whatsoever about The Pearl's qualities, aesthetic or otherwise. (beat) With all due respect, he's not much more than a glorified security guard. Will's jaw tightens. He gives Mr. Pierce a cold look but toes the party line... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: He's right. I'm only here as a certified independent third party to assess your safety and security measures and, if they're compliant, sign off on them so Mr. Pierce's company can give you the thumbs up to officially open the top half of your building. It's not really my place to comment.

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: I know why you're here, Mr. Ford. And I know it's not your place to comment -- which is precisely why I'm asking you to. Please, your honest opinion.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: It's been my experience that when people ask for someone's honest opinion, that's usually the last thing they want.

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: Humor me. Will glances at Mr. Pierce who gives him a stiff "go ahea nod. Will clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Well, let me start by saying that what you've built here is truly incredible. You should be proud.

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: But...?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: But...if it were up to me, I would never insure this building. Not ina million years. Mr. Pierce eyes Will sternly. The room tightens.

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: And why is that? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: You've built a vertical city here, Mr. Zhao, which is impressive sure, but you've brought with it every single fire, safety and security challenge I can think of -- and you've not only brought them all indoors, you've trapped them three thousand feet in the air. (beat) Everything in this building has to go right every single time and too little has to go wrong once for there to be a very serious problem without a viable solution. (beat) Look, I'm a simple man. I like my beer cold, my wings hot and fireworks on the 4th of July. But if you're asking for my honest opinion about what you've built here, it would be this: I don't get it. Then Will looks at Mr. Pierce. WILL (cont'd) But, Hell, I'm just a glorified security guard. So what do I know? The room sucks in. Mr. Pierce shoots daggers at Will. But Zhao smiles and says with all sincerity...

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: Wonderful. Now I know I can trust you. Zhao pulls out a TRANSLUCENT FLASH DRIVE. ZHAO (cont'd) This drive contains the machine codes for The Pearl's fire and safety control measures -- a master key, if you will, to the entire building. They're linked to your laptop alone and, once installed, will only be accessible for a twenty-four hour window before self-deleting. I trust that will be enough time for you to thoroughly vet our security and submit your final analysis for Mr. Pierce's approval? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: More than enough. Thank you. Zhao slides the FLASH DRIVE to Will who uploads it onto h laptop. A COUNTDOWN CLOCK ticks down from 24 hours. Zhao glides to the door and looks back expectantly...

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: Come on, if we hurry there's still time.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Time for what?

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: For you to get it. Zhao smiles. Will looks a little confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And finally we see it -- the crowning achievement of this incredible structure, and the very thing that gives the building its name:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: encases the upper most echelon of The Pearl -- an observation deck fashioned entirely out of laser-cut crystalline glass whose triangular facets fit so perfectl one into the next, that they almost disappear entirely. What's more, the footprint of the glass deck itself exten beyond the profile of the building's rooftop allowing for the stout-hearted to walk out beyond the roof and look straight down to the ground, nearly a mile below. It's nothing short of breath-taking. We find Zhao and Will up here alone. Will takes in the sight dumb-founded. Zhao stares across the Victoria Harbo

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: I grew up over there, across the water on the Kowloon side. My father sold fish. His father sold fish and his father before him. So I grew up selling fish. Every morning up before the sun. Bone tired in the boat as it went down. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ZHAO (cont'd) (beat) When I was six years old, our house was burned to the ground by some men my father refused to pay. They killed him that same night when he confronted them in the street. (beat) My mother raised me and my eight brothers in sisters in a one-room house smaller than my bathroom is now. At night, I remember staring at this very skyline through our window, as my brothers and sisters slept -- knowing someday I would make my mark, someday I would change what I saw out that window. And no one would ever take it from me.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: I'm sorry for your loss. But why are you telling me all this?

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: Because you and I aren't so different from each other, Mr. Ford. We're both men from humble beginnings who shaped the world around us, not the other way around.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Yeah -- next time remind me to invite you to my skyscraper. Zhao chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: TouchГ©. Zhao checks his watch then glances at the sun, doing a calculation in his head. ZHAO (cont'd) Walk out there and turn around. Unsure but curious, Will walks out onto the EXTENDED DECK the section. He turns back to face Zhao. ZHAO (cont'd) Once we open The Pearl, the place you're standing on right now will become the newest wonder of the modern world. A testament to what we can do. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ZHAO (cont'd) (beat) Count to three and you'll see what I mean. Uncertain but game, Will plays along...

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: One...two...three. On three, the sun hits a certain point in the sky, its ra striking the geodesic dome just so, causing the light to refract perfectly, bouncing off of each precisely placed facet resulting in a jaw-dropping effect. Suddenly, as if by magic, the deck, the glass, the entire dome itself, everything -- COMPLETELY VANISHES. Out on the extended deck, a sheer 3,000 foot drop below h it looks as though Will is standing on nothing at all, suspended in mid-air.

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: Welcome to heaven, Mr. Ford.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pearl looms in the distance, the sun low on the horiz The street is choked with PEOPLE and VENDORS hawking thei goods. We find Will and Horace waiting at a NOODLE STAND.

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: Welcome to heaven? He really said that?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: But like cool or creepy?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Kinda both.

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: Rich guys. Will blows on his hands, it's a bit nippy out.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: I didn't think Hong Kong got this cold. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: Chinese New Year around the corner. Always the coldest month.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Think it'll snow?

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: Are you serious? We're almost at the equator. At sea level.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: All I'm saying is my leg knows when it's gonna snow -- and it's barking right now.

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: Your leg is a moron. I think it's snowed like once here in two-hundred years.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: So you're saying there's a chance. Horace rolls his eyes. The VENDOR hands over two cartons noodles. They scoop them up and move off, landing us on

dialogues.speaker: A RAT-FACED MAN
dialogues.text: lurking nearby, clocking Will and Horace with intent. He moves out, stalking the duo. We track with Will and Horace as they move through the throng, immersing ourselves in the vibrant sights and sou of a bustling Hong Kong street market.

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: Best noodles in town -- 90% why I live around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: I thought you lived at The Pearl.

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: Hell no. Can't afford it.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: I just thought he'd want you there for security.

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: I run security for the building not him. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: HORACE (cont'd) He's got his own private outfit, they been with him for a while. Plus with this bad boy... Horace raises his crippled hand. HORACE (cont'd) ..-body detail isn't really in the cards for me. That hits Will hard. Horace notices. HORACE (cont'd) Hey -- I didn't mean to--

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: No, it's okay. It's fine. It's the truth. They walk in silence for a beat. WILL (cont'd) I see that boy's face sometimes, you know? When I can't sleep. The wife and daughter too. All of them.

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: You talk to somebody?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Sarah. A counselor a couple times. But it's never gone away. Not completely. The weird part is I don't think I'd want it to, you know? Horace nods, feeling for his friend. The pair stop. Will looks away, barely holding it together in this moment. The Rat-Faced Man, sensing his chance, SNAPS OPEN A SWITCHBLADE and closes in on Will and Horace... WILL (cont'd) I couldn't save them, I couldn't save the team. I couldn't save anyone.

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: Hey -- that's not on you. Will -- look at me. Will does. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: HORACE (cont'd) That's not on you -- okay? The team knew the risks going in. We all signed up for it. We knew the risks. That's not yours to carry.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: Now, I'd hug you in public, but I don't want people to think we're dating. Will laughs, unaware as the Rat-Faced Man approaches behi him raising his blade and looking for all the world like he's about to stab Will in the back. Will senses something behind him. He turns just as the Ra Faced man swings the blade -- slicing the strap on Will's LAPTOP BAG and TAKES OFF RUNNING WITH IT, vanishing into flow of the market. HORACE (cont'd) I got him. Horace bolts after the thief, rushing headlong into the throng of MARKET GO-ERS. Not one to sit on the sideline, Will scan the area quickl spotting: A DOUCHEBAG ON A DUCATI. leaning against his red metal phallus, revving the thrott at a pair of PRETTY GIRLS passing by. He moves off his bi to call after them. They ain't having it. The Douchebag turns back just in time to see Will swingin his leg over the Ducati 959.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Next time try flowers. VRROOM! Will takes off in a blur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horace runs full tilt after the Rat-Faced Man, pushing BYSTANDERS aside. He's closing in on him but just then th Rat-Faced Man wheels, pulling out a Glock and firing --

dialogues.speaker: BLAM-BLAM-BLAM
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: MARKET GO-ERS scream and scatter. Horace dives behind a trashcan -- .40 caliber rounds sparking off it. Utter chaos as the thief spots a MOTORCYCLE RIDER stopped the light in front of him. He points the business end of his Glock at the biker, commandeering the ride and tearing out of there just as Horace comes to a running stop, defeated. Suddenly, another roar. Horace spins, narrowly jumping ou of the way as Will, riding hell-bent for leather on the Ducati, rips past him in hot pursuit. And now we find ourselves in... A _(reasonably-priced) HONG KONG STYLE MOTORCYCLE CHASE, weaving between ONCOMING TROLLEYS and throughout the precarious inclines and narrow streets of Hong Kong prope All of this ends when Will draws even with the thief and leaps from his motorcycle, tackling the assailant to the ground into a

dialogues.speaker: TRASH-STREWN ALLEY
dialogues.text: The Rat-Faced Man goes down hard, dropping his gun. Will gets to his feet first and goes to lay hands on him the shifty thief pulls out his SWITCHBLADE and takes a swing, slicing Will on the arm. He jumps back clutching t wound, blood already starting to pour. The Rat-Faced Man bounces to his feet and squares off wit Will, a man twice his size. A cornered animal, he attacks, swinging wildly. Will is surprisingly agile -- especially so considering his leg. Will dodges one lunge, then another. He's got this guy ti now -- and on the assailant's third attempt, Will catches the Rat-Faced Man's wrist, snapping it in one precise mov The Rat-Faced Man howls in pain, dropping the knife. Will clocks an INTRICATE TATTOO on the thief's forearm. The Rat-Faced Man scrambles back, looking down at Will's feet where the discarded GLOCK rests. The thief looks to Will, then the gun -- is Will gonna pick it up? Just then, an out-of-breath Horace comes rushing around t corner, spotting the standoff. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Will reaches down BUT DOESN'T PICK UP THE GUN -- instead picks up his LAPTOP BAG and kicks the gun away. The Rat-Faced Man isn't going to stick around to find out why. He takes off running in the other direction. Horace joins Will as the duo watch the little man run off

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: Welcome to Hong Kong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [READER'S NOTE: in scenes containing only Chinese characters, all dialogue will be spoken in the native Cantonese (with appropriate subtitles). This will be deno by the use of italics in the dialoque block. Thank you fo your time and attention to this matter. We now return you to your regularly scheduled screenplay-reading activities

dialogues.speaker: A DEAD GUARD
dialogues.text: slumped lifelessly on the floor of his GUARD BOOTH. A fre bullet hole in his forehead. A WOMAN'S HAND reaches into frame and yanks the ACCESS CARD off of his shirt. We pan off the guard with the woman's hand, revealing we're...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LOW-SLUNG CONCRETE BUILDING on the outskirts of the cit THREE SILHOUETTES - the woman flanked by TWO MEN -- move away from the guard booth and toward the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIX WORKERS man a CONTROL STATION at this secure off-site facility. Only today it's not so secure. The door opens. The workers turn to see XIA (pronounced "Shi-ya") standing in the doorway holding the access card A slip of a woman with a pixie cut and a pretty smile, Xi flashes it just before she pulls out two silenced 9mms an rips off SIX SHOTS, dispatching each worker in turn. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Xia enters when suddenly two HEAVY DUTY GUARDS appear out nowhere right on top of her -- a surprise. In a blink, Xia launches herself, climbing the guards lik jungle gym as she applies some deft and deadly Black Wido scissor kick action, ending it with a coup de grace by simultaneously shooting each guard with the others gun. It's all over in under three seconds. Xia pops up. Blows a stray strand hair out of her face an moves off nonchalantly revealing the two men she came in with, a TECHIE and a TOUGH GUY, standing in the doorway having just watched her in action. The boys share a look: do not fuck this with chick. They move into the room to do their job. The TECHIE, dumps a rag-dolled worker out of his chair an pulls himself up to the control board, going to work...

dialogues.speaker: TECHIE
dialogues.text: I can get access to nominal control -- but anything above the 95th floor, in the residential section, will require the baseline machine code.

dialogues.speaker: XIA
dialogues.text: You'll have what you need, just make sure I get what I need. The Tough Guy's cellphone rings. He answers. His face goe sour. He hangs up. Shakes his head. Xia nods. XIA (cont'd) Time for Plan B.

dialogues.speaker: HORACE, (PRE-LAP)
dialogues.text: How come you didn't pick up his gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A well-appointed but modest one-bedroom apartment on the second floor. Horace inspects Will's wound.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: I mean you could've picked it up but you didn't. Why? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: I don't know. I haven't touched one in such a long time -- I guess I just didn't want to hurt anybody today. There's more to it, but Horace leaves it alone. He stands

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: You're gonna need stitches. I'11l get my kit. Horace stands up and moves into the adjacent BATHROOM and starts digging out his med kit. Will's phone rings. Sarah is FaceTiming him. He answers.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Hey baby -- how are the pandas? But, surprisingly, Sarah is back at The Pearl. [INTERCUT NECESSARY].

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: We didn't really get to see them -- Henry ate some weird candy and started throwing up, so we came back.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BATHROOM
dialogues.text: Horace gets a text message. He reads it. Looks at himself in the mirror -- a haunted man stares back.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE PEARL
dialogues.text: Sarah ushers Henry and Georgia off the elevator and towar their luxury apartment door.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Is he okay? Did he have an attack?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: No, his breathing is fine. No fever or anything, he just needs to lie down.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Okay -- I'm coming back right now.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Don't rush -- we're cool. Just, you know, no pandas. Which sucks. Henry chimes in... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: It sucks!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Don't say "sucks", honey.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: We'll go tomorrow, buddy. If you're feeling better. (to Sarah) Alright, I'm gonna hustle back. Love you.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Love you. Sarah hangs up, unlocking the door to their apartment whe suddenly out of an adjacent APARTMENT DOOR, SIX SECURITY GUARDS appear, carrying HEAVY BLACK DUFFLE BAGS, two of t wheeling a HANDCART with a CONTAINER on it. They stop sho at the sight of Sarah and her kids. The LEAD SECURITY GUARD, sporting a Samurai topknot hairc smiles kindly...

dialogues.speaker: LEAD SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Sorry, miss. We thought this floor was empty.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Yeah -- me too. The kids stare at the men. It's a strangely charged momen Sarah notices a faded word stenciled on the container: TMlapalmlwot Sarah doesn't know what it means but her Spidey-sense sta tingling. Something about these guys isn't right. SARAH (cont'd) Everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: LEAD SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Everything's fine. Routine floor check.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Takes six guys to check an empty floor, huh? The Lead Security Guard smiles tightly. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LEAD SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: We like to be thorough.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I'll say.

dialogues.speaker: LEAD SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: You have a nice night, ma'am. With that, the team moves down the hall toward an EXIT DO one of the Guards shoots a glance over his shoulder, clocking her. He asks under his breath...

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Want me to clean that up?

dialogues.speaker: LEAD SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Nah. It'll take care of itself. They push through the exit door, disappearing downward. Sarah watches them go.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIA
dialogues.text: Mom -- were those guys the police?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: No, honey. They're not the police. Her mind ticking, Sarah hovers her thumb over Will's numb about to call him back. Then she thinks better of it and pockets her phone, opening the door and ushering her kids inside. A beat later and we hear her throw the deadbolt.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE SAND
dialogues.text: being poured onto the ground. We're...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The six guards, now sporting serious CHEMICAL MASKS pour streams of GRANULATED WHITE POWDER over every surface as though they were salting a road -- a winter wonderland. The Lead Guard holds the exit door open as his team moves past him, pulling off their masks and heading up the stai The last man standing, The Lead Security Guard, his hand poised above a RED FIRE ALARM HANDLE, takes in the powder landscape in front of him: a entirely frosted floor. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He yanks down the alarm handle and exits through the door We wait in the 96th floor lobby as the alarm blares. Emergency lights flash. Then the SPRINKLER SYSTEM engages dousing the entire floor with a wet down from on high. BUT THE MOMENT THE WATER HITS THE POWDER, IT IGNITES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will hangs up. In the bathroom, Horace looks concerned. H calls out to Will...

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: They went back to The Pearl?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Henry wasn't feeling well.

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: That's too bad.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Yup -- no pandas. But something else is bugging Will... WILL (cont'd) Hey -- did you notice the ink on that guy's forearm?

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: Who the little guy?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: Didn't notice. Horace grabs his med kit and exits into

dialogues.speaker: THE LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: where Will continues...

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Looked like an affiliation -- maybe gang ink. I'11l sketch it out for the cops. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: We're not gonna call the cops. Horace's voice has changed, it's colder now, darker... HORACE (cont'd) You couldn't just let him take the bag, could you? Had to be a hero. Always gotta be the hero.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: What are you talking about-- Horace pulls out a .45 AUTOMATIC from the med bag and poi it squarely at his friend. Will stands, wary...

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: I tried to do this clean -- but now you're gonna have to take the fall for all of it.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Whoa -- H -- what's going on? Talk to me. Put the gun down and let's talk.

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: I don't have a choice -- I don't have a fucking choice now. It's too late. You messed it up. Why'd you have to mess it up?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Slow down--

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. -- BANG! Horace fires just as Will dives out of the way, taking cover behind the kitchen counter divide. Horace rounds that corner and pulls the trigger but Will already closed the gap, knocking the muzzle aside causing the shot to go wide, disarming Horace. The pair find themselves in close quarters hand-to-hand melee; each man expertly trained. A brutal affair unfolds as Will and Horace fight to the death. The confines of the apartment take the brunt as books fal from bookshelves, lamps are sent crashing, pictures shatt Only one man will make it out alive. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Horace catches Will with an elbow stunning him; he KICKS WILL'S PROSTHETIC LEG -- a dirty move -- then sweeps the other, dropping Will to the floor -- THUD. Horace spots the wayward .45 and snatches it up, turning fire only to have Will use his good leg to kick out Horace's, dropping him to the floor as well. Will pounces on top of Horace as the two former teammates struggle mightily against each other for control of the . when suddenly -- BANG. The gun goes off. A moment as we don't know who got the worst of it. Then Horace coughs up blood, his eyes rollin back in his head. A look of dismay washes over Will's face. He releases his death grip on his longtime friend. Without missing a beat, Will checks Horace's injury: a gunshot wound just below the breast bone. Blood pumps out rhythmically, air sucks in -- a mortal blow. Will applies direct pressure with his hand as best he can but he knows he's gonna need something to stop the bleedi

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: You're gonna be alright -- sit up -- lean forward. Will maneuvers Horace's body as he starts to wheeze from collapsed lung. Horace apologizes, rapidly turning pale.

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: I'm sorry -- I'm sorry --

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Hey -- just stay with me -- Look at me -- fight it now. You gotta fight it. Will moves into

dialogues.speaker: THE ADJACENT BATHROOM
dialogues.text: and grabs a HAND-TOWEL to help staunch the bleeding. That when Will stops short at the sight of: A_HAND PROTRUDING OUT FROM BEHIND THE SHOWER CURTAIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will yanks the curtain back, revealing the BODY OF A DEAD MAN IN A SUIT, crumpled lifelessly in the tub. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Will nearly stumbles at the shocking sight. He rushes out of the bathroom and back to

dialogues.speaker: THE LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Where Horace is paper white and not long for this world. Will kneels down next to him. WILL (cont'd) Tell me what's going on -- if you tell me, I can help you. Horace? Horace?

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: ...They weren't supposed to go back...they weren't supposed to be there... Will's blood goes cold.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Who wasn't supposed to be there? (beat) What did you do? Horace chokes out a ragged...

dialogues.speaker: HORACE
dialogues.text: I -- I'm sorry. And then he's gone. Will lets go of his friend. And that' when he hears it: SIRENS. In the distance -- a lot of the Will moves to Horace's window, yanking open the blinds to see a horror unimaginable: THE PEARL IS ON FIRE. An entire floor, maybe two, are ablaze halfway up the building. Based on the silhouette of the structure, Will knows Sarah and his kids are above the fire line. His heart sinks. Then more SIRENS. But these are much closer. Will glances down to:

dialogues.speaker: THE STREET BELOW
dialogues.text: where a swarm of HONG KONG POLICE (HKP) and SWAT VANS screech to a stop out in front. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The van doors open and out pours an ASSAULT TEAM. They hustle into the apartment building. His mind racing, Will only has moments to form a plan. Quickly he snags his prosthesis, securing it to his leg. He slings his laptop bag and grabs the .45, tucking it aw He hears HEAVY FOOTFALLS as the assault team ascends the stairs. Will moves to the door, snugging up against it. He glances down at his feet -- at first we're not sure wh Then a little BLACK SNAKE slithers under the door. A FIBE OPTIC CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE DOOR
dialogues.text: the ASSAULT TEAM stacks up. The OPTICS MAN crouches at th the door working the snake-cam -- its MONITOR showing the battered apartment and a portion of Horace's slack body. WILL watches the snake-cam's head twist around and just a it bends toward him he snatches it up and yanks it hard..

dialogues.speaker: THE OPTICS MAN,
dialogues.text: holding the other end of it, is yanked head-first into th door -- WHAM! Will opens the door and grabs the dazed Optics Man -- snapping him back into the apartment and shutting the doo The Assault Team on the other side of the door unloads on it -- shredding the wood to pieces.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE APARTMENT
dialogues.text: Will headbutts the Optics Man out cold, then he snatches FLASHBANG GRENADE off of his webbing, pulling the pin. The limp Optics Man in one hand, Will tosses the flashban through one of the GUNSHOT HOLES in the Swiss Cheese door Shouts of alarm followed by a THUNDEROUS BANG. Will opens the door just wide enough to kick the Optics M through the opening onto his stunned comrades, knocking a few of them over like bowling pins. Will slams the door shut and moves to a STANDING CABINET, shouldering it, tipping it over to block the front door. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The assault team on the other side begins battering the d open with a METAL RAM. Will only has seconds left. He races to the window, tearing off the blinds and throwi open the pane. CRACK -- the door breaks open and the Assault Team rushes just as Will disappears out the window, dropping from sig

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will hits the ground hard -- his leg goes out from under as he cries out in pain. He gathers himself quickly, getting to his feet to find himself SURROUNDED. The HKP have both ends of the alley blocked off. They inc toward Will from either end, closing in on him like a vic Will glances up to see the ASSAULT TEAM in the apartment aiming down on him from the window above. He's trapped. It's over. Will puts his hands up, pointing desperately at The Pearl, ablaze in the skyline...

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: My family! My family is trapped in that building! But they don't speak English and he doesn't speak Chinese WILL (cont'd) Please! Listen to me! You have to listen! My family--

dialogues.speaker: BANG
dialogues.text: A shotgun blast strikes Will in the chest -- a non-lethal BEANBAG round knocking the wind out of him. Then another, then a third. The big man drops to a knee, weakened, unab to catch his breath. The HKP close in, subsuming him.

dialogues.speaker: WILL'S BIG WRISTS
dialogues.text: cinched in tiny Chinese handcuffs, as he's led through th throng of cops toward a waiting POLICE VAN. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: THE PEARL
dialogues.text: burns in the distance as Will is shoved into the back of van. He looks up longingly at the burning high rise -- th only people in this world he loves trapped inside. The van doors close on Will's face revealing the burning high rise in their blacked-out windows. The doors recede from us -- moving away from The Pearl, a from the very place Will wants to be most.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Distraught, Sarah finishes leaving a voicemail for Will. The fire alarm blares. EMERGENCY LIGHTS flash brightly. A ALARM VOICE repeats itself in CHINESE. Henry and Georgia look scared. Sarah hangs up and ushers them to the couch.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Get on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIA
dialogues.text: Mom -- what's going on? Are we gonna be okay?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: We're going to be fine. There's a fire in the building, but we're safe here -- everything's going to be okay. I'm going to go talk to the firemen. Sarah moves into the bathroom and turns on the cold water the bathtub, pulling the stopper shut to fill it. She gra a towel, rolling it into a tube. Exiting the bathroom, she kneels down in front of her kid SARAH (cont'd) Look at me: stay on this couch and do not move until I comeback. Understand? Henry and Georgia nod. Sarah hands Georgia her phone. SARAH (cont'd) If daddy calls, tell him we're okay and that I'll be right back. (beat) I love you both very much. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sarah kisses them then exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah wedges the rolled up towel against the foot of the door. Then she goes to the elevators and sees that the display above the door shows a red FIRE LOGO with an X ov it. Elevators have been automatically disabled. Sarah finds the FIRE EXIT door and pushes through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah moves down from the 98th floor -- instantly feeling WALL OF HEAT rushing at her. She pushes on, down one flig and nearly to the next landing when -- KA-BOOM! The door to the 96th floor ROCKETS OFF ITS HINGES, slammi into the wall opposite, crumpling like tinfoil. Hungry fo fresh oxygen, the flames from the raging fire snake throu the new opening into the stairwell. Sarah scrambles backward -- turning to run back up the wa she came. There's no way down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Controlled chaos as crowds have gathered to gape at the unimaginable sight. An adjacent thirty-foot wide HD BILLBOARD on the side of a NEARBY BUILDING plays the news the fire for all to see. EMERGENCY SERVICES are already on the scene, cordoning of the area. Amidst it, we find the FIRE CHIEF walking throu the throng talking to the man in charge, CAPTAIN CHAN.

dialogues.speaker: FIRE CHIEF
dialogues.text: ...Fire's burning unchecked on the 96th. We're evacuating the building as we speak. Gonna take some time.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN CHAN
dialogues.text: What about people above the 96th? Has anyone contacted them?

dialogues.speaker: FIRE CHIEF
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN CHAN
dialogues.text: No? Why not? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FIRE CHIEF
dialogues.text: Because there's no one above the 96th floor -- it's not open yet.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN CHAN
dialogues.text: You're kidding me.

dialogues.speaker: FIRE CHIEF
dialogues.text: The owner of the building is in the penthouse on the 220th -- that's it. And the fire will never get there.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN CHAN
dialogues.text: How do you know that?

dialogues.speaker: FIRE CHIEF
dialogues.text: The automatic fire doors and dampening measures have engaged, sealing the fire in place. If it can't go up and it can't go down, it'll burn itself out in under two hours, even if we don't do anything -- no fuel, no fire.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN CHAN
dialogues.text: You're telling me the building is putting out the fire by itself?

dialogues.speaker: FIRE CHIEF
dialogues.text: That's an oversimplification, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN CHAN
dialogues.text: Really? Cuz it sounds to me like you're out of a job, Chief. With that, Chan yanks open the door to an EMERGENCY OPS TRAILER, disappearing inside. The Chief follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah pushes through the door, coughing. Henry and Georgi rush to her. She kneels down and hugs her cubs tightly.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIA
dialogues.text: Daddy didn't call.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: That's okay. Gimme the phone. Let's try him together. Sarah dials Will one final time...  48.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Police Van, escorted by HKP on motorcycles, moves thr the crowded streets, sirens wailing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will rides wordlessly with the assault team. Suddenly a BUZZING. Will glances at his laptop bag -- he can see his phone in the mesh webbing of one of its outer pockets. It's Sarah's face. She's calling him. It's nothing short of torture for Will as he's feet away but can do nothing.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Answer it! The assault team ignores him. WILL (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: ANSWER MY PHONE
dialogues.text: Will tries to answer it himself, moving to get up when he takes the butt of a rifle to the gut for his trouble. Will crumples. Coughing. His phone shows the missed call from Sarah. Wills swings his gaze to a SMIRKING GUARD. Will's eyes narrow, he's gonna--

dialogues.speaker: WHAMMMMM
dialogues.text: OUR WORLD GOES UPSIDE DOWN. We're trapped in a violent clothes dryer as we spin and tumble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police van is T-boned by a BATTERING RAM TRUCK, sendi it spinning like a rolling pin into the side of a buildin Instantly, a HALF-DOZEN GANGSTERS, sporting CHINESE DRAGO MASKS, race up in MOTORCYCLES, ambushing HKP officers. It's over in a blink as the Gangsters cut down the cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dark in here. The interior van light stutters, offer an eerie strobe effect. We're completely upside down. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: GUNFIRE and shouting outside. A turkey shoot underway. In the back of the van, the Assault Team members groan, s out cold. Will shakes out the cobwebs just in time to hea the ROARING WHINE of a gas-powered blade saw. Suddenly a showering of hot sparks rain down inside the van -- the doors are being cut open from the outside. Then a CROWBAR is wedged in prying this prize box open -- one thrust, then two. The doors crack free revealing:

dialogues.speaker: THREE DRAGON-MASKED GANGSTERS,
dialogues.text: smoke roiling past their horns in wicked slow motion. The Smirking Guard goes for his gun but takes two rounds the chest from the LEAD GANGSTER. The Lead Gangster swing the barrel of his carbine to Will. A moment as it looks like this might be the most expensiv short film in the history of cinema. But then the Lead Gangster drops his weapon and reaches p Will, snagging the thing he came for -- the LAPTOP BAG. The Lead Gangster makes sure the laptop is inside, then h tosses the bag to a waiting COMRADE on a motorcycle. The comrade tears ass out of there. Fast approaching sirens. No time, the masked Gangsters ba away, splitting apart on their motorcycles -- heist compl

dialogues.speaker: IN THE VAN
dialogues.text: Will hears sirens and weighs his options: stay here and s arrested or seize the moment and go rescue his family. For a guy like Will, there's only one answer. He searches for the CUFF KEYS, finding them on the Smirki Guard's belt. Will quickly frees himself, snags a SIDEARM and exits.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE VAN
dialogues.text: the SIRENS have grown louder, he's got only seconds to ma his escape. BYSTANDERS have begun to gather -- they point at Will when he appears from the wreckage. Some start shouting. Many others record it all on their smartphones. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Will gets his bearings quickly, scanning the skyline unti he finds what he's looking for, then he heads off in that direction -- people part like the Red Sea as this massive maniac with a gun moves toward them. We swing around Will to reveal his goal: THE PEARL, burni like a fuse in the night sky.

dialogues.speaker: THE PEARL
dialogues.text: burning on a TELEVISION SCREEN. We're...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing in front of his wall-sized touch screen, Zhao watches his building burn on the local news. If this worries him, it doesn't show. The three suits sitting at the table, however, are starti to sweat. One of them whispers to Mr. Pierce...

dialogues.speaker: SUIT
dialogues.text: Helluva first day, huh? Mr. Pierce swallows hard -- this might be the worst day i his insurance underwriting life. He speaks up...

dialogues.speaker: MR. PIERCE
dialogues.text: Should we evacuate?

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: Evacuate?

dialogues.speaker: MR. PIERCE
dialogues.text: Yes. Take your helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: And why would we do that?

dialogues.speaker: MR. PIERCE
dialogues.text: The building's on fire.

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: The building isn't on fire. The 96th floor is on fire. Mr. Pierce nearly scoffs -- he looks at the suits to back him up. They look away. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ZHAO (cont'd) Mr. Pierce, our bodies are the result of millions of years of evolution. When faced with heat, we sweat. When faced with danger, our blood courses with Adrenaline and Cortisol. When faced with extreme cold, hypothermia, our bodies act to conserve heat, cutting off blood to the extremities -- any sacrifice to keep the core warm. The brain. The Pearl is the same. We're sacrificing one floor, so that the rest may live. Zhao nods at a set of security monitors, showing the fire containment on the 96th floor. ZHAO (cont'd) The ninety-sixth floor will burn to ash, the fire will die and we'll rebuild it. The Pearl itself will never be in jeopardy. I assure you. Just then, the TV News cuts away from its coverage of the fire to show a STOCK PHOTO OF WILL FORD next to SMARTPHON VIDEO of his escape from the overturned HKP Van. The room goes silent. Zhao un-mutes the screen...

dialogues.speaker: NEWSCASTER
dialogues.text: ...the American is the prime suspect in a double-homicide and is wanted for his apparent connection to the fire at The Pearl... Zhao turns to his head of security, a no nonsense Israeli man named DOV (40s).

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: Get me answers. Dov nods and exits. Puzzled, Zhao turns his attention bac to the image of Will on his screen.

dialogues.speaker: WILL'S FACE
dialogues.text: on the same newscast, playing through a window. We're...  52.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The broadcast plays inside a bar, patrons are rapt by it. We find Will watching too from an ALLEYWAY. He scans the area, every TV screen he sees is playing the same thing: face right next to the burning Pearl. He's a wanted man. Will's mind churns: his image is everywhere and he's a fo taller than everyone in this city -- he'll stick out like sore thumb on the street. Unless... Catercorner, Will spots a BEGGAR in a WHEELCHAIR panhandl

dialogues.speaker: THE BEGGAR
dialogues.text: looking up at us. A FISTFUL OF CASH is held out to him. Reveal Will as he brings his finger to his lips: SHHHH. T Beggar smiles a toothless smile and reaches for the cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Georgia submerges bathroom towels in the tub as Sarah kne in front of Henry holding an ASTHMA INHALER.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I'm fine, mom.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You're fine now, honey, but we're about to go out there and there's a lot of smoke and bad air and I don't want you to have an attack, okay? (to Georgia) Dunk them all the way, make sure the whole thing gets wet. The hand towels too. Georgia does as she's told. Sarah looks back to her son.. SARAH (cont'd) Two quick inhales, please? Henry obliges. SARAH (cont'd) Good job. Thank you. (pocketing it) I'll have it right here with me if you need it, okay? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIA
dialogues.text: Mom -- are we gonna die? The directness of the question stops Sarah short.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: No honey, we're not gonna die.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Where's Dad?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: He's not here.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Is he coming to get us? They look at their mother. Sarah knows this moment matter

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: There's nothing in this world that would stop your father from keeping you both safe.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: And you too, right?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: And me too. Sarah opens her toiletry kit and takes out a pair of CHRO SHEARING SCISSORS. SARAH (cont'd) Hand me those towels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A motorcycle rips toward the chain-link fence. The Tough Guy, now dressed as the security guard, opens the gate. Clutching Will's laptop bag, the Biker roars through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Biker rushes into the room and hands the laptop to Xi She tosses it to the Techie who snags it out of the air a quickly boots it up, gaining access the precious control protocols he needs. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: XIA
dialogues.text: Do it. ON SCREEN we see full access granted. The Techie expertly engages all of the anti-fire measures from the 95th down, cascade of GREEN COLORED FLOORS all the way to the bottom Then he deactivates all of the anti-fire measures from th 96th to the top -- all of those floors BLINK RED. With a swipe on the touchscreen, the FIRE DOORS from the 97th on up slide open, feeding the fire with fresh air.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE 96TH FLOOR
dialogues.text: we see the flames ROAR UPWARD, like a living creature -- twisting tornado of fire thirsty for fuel and hungry for oxygen. The blaze climbs higher -- a kiln burning white-h

dialogues.speaker: TECHIE
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, I give you a 6.5 billion dollar chimney.

dialogues.speaker: XIA
dialogues.text: Lock it in. Some fancy keystrokes add an encryption code to the chang in the building, effectively making them permanent.

dialogues.speaker: TECHIE
dialogues.text: Encrypted. He pops up and hands Will's laptop to Xia. TECHIE (cont'd) You've got full systems control from that laptop and that laptop only. No pass code needed. Plug and play. Everyone else is locked out.

dialogues.speaker: XIA
dialogues.text: How long will it take them to crack your encryption and regain control?

dialogues.speaker: TECHIE
dialogues.text: I don't know -- seven hundred years? I'm the only one who knows the logarithmic base cipher I used to encrypt it, so I'm literally the only person on planet earth who can crack it. Pretty smart, huh? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: XIA
dialogues.text: Not that smart. THWIP! One silenced 9mm round to the forehead drops the Techie. She tucks her gun away and slides Will's LAPTOP into her messenger bag for safe keeping, pulling out a GLOSSY BLACK BRICK with a BLINKING RED LIGHT in exchange. The phone in the control room starts RINGING madly. She ignores it, placing the black brick on the doorjamb with magnetic CHUNK. She activates it and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Xia moves away from the facility toward the front gate. S touches her ear, speaking to someone unseen...

dialogues.speaker: XIA
dialogues.text: Heading to on-site. The Tough Guy looks over from the GUARD SHACK...

dialogues.speaker: TOUGH GUY
dialogues.text: We done?

dialogues.speaker: XIA
dialogues.text: Yep. THWIP-THWIP! Two shots in the ten-ring. He's dead before he hits the ground. She doesn't so much as break stride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Choked with smoke. Licks of flame are visible through the exterior windows, reaching up from below. It's only a matter of time before the fire claims this floor as well. The door to the apartment opens, revealing Sarah sporting wet hand towel tied around her nose and mouth like a cowb She's cut a hole through the sopping bath towel for her head, wearing it like a poncho. She steps into the hallway, holding hands with Henry and Georgia who are dressed just like her: wet towel mask and poncho, giving the kids the look of tiny ghost bank robbe

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIA
dialogues.text: Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
