dialogues.text: Zhao stares at his giant WALL MONITOR: every floor above 95th is BLINKING RED, the anti-fire measures all read as OFF-LINE. Clearly, something is rotten in Denmark. The suits are agitated. One sips a bottle of water, his hand shaking as he does. Mr. Pierce paces, nervous.

dialogues.speaker: MR. PIERCE
dialogues.text: I thought you said the fire wouldn't spread. You said it would be contained. What's wrong with your building? Don't you have sprinkler systems?

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: Yes and the sprinkler systems on the 96th floor engaged as designed.

dialogues.speaker: MR. PIERCE
dialogues.text: Really? Then why didn't the fire go out?

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: Because the water caused the fire.

dialogues.speaker: MR. PIERCE
dialogues.text: Come again?

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: It's the only conclusion. And there's only one way water itself can cause a fire: through an exothermic chemical reaction. Which means this wasn't an accident -- it was arson. Dov, Zhao's body man, returns...

dialogues.speaker: DOV
dialogues.text: Local control is completely locked out and off-site's not answering. The entire system's been compromised -- our techs are trying to crack it. (beat) And there's something else.

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: What? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DOV
dialogues.text: Our log codes show Will Ford's family swiped into their residence two hours ago, before the fire. That news puzzles Zhao, but he's got bigger fish to fry..

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: How long to get control of the building back?

dialogues.speaker: DOV
dialogues.text: I don't think they really know, sir.

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: What was their estimate?

dialogues.speaker: DOV
dialogues.text: Eighteen hours. The suit drinking the bottle water nearly chokes on it.

dialogues.speaker: MR. PIERCE
dialogues.text: Eighteen hours?! We don't have eighteen minutes! This thing's burning like a match!

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: Matches burn from the top down.

dialogues.speaker: MR. PIERCE
dialogues.text: Oh fuck you, Buddha! We need to leave!

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: You're missing my point. With the fire doors open above the fire and closed below them, this building isn't burning like a match -- it's burning like a kiln. It's super- heating.

dialogues.speaker: MR. PIERCE
dialogues.text: Are you saying it'll collapse?

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: No -- The Pearl could burn to cinders and never collapse. Collapse isn't the issue.

dialogues.speaker: MR. PIERCE
dialogues.text: Then what is? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: The real issue is that the building doesn't know it's on fire. And if it doesn't know it's on fire, it can't act to preserve itself. Which means the fire will grow hotter and hotter and spread faster and faster until it has nothing left to feed on. Until it eats itself to death. Until it consumes us whole.

dialogues.speaker: MR. PIERCE
dialogues.text: Fantastic. Wonderful. I think we've all learned something really valuable here today. I know I have. Now can we please get on the fucking helicopter?

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: You know what's interesting about you, Mr. Pierce?

dialogues.speaker: MR. PIERCE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: Nothing. Dov chimes in, speaking softly...

dialogues.speaker: DOV
dialogues.text: Sir, you know as well as I do that if the fire gets within twenty floors of us it will over-heat the air around the helipad making liftoff impossible. If we're going to evacuate, we need to do it now. Zhao weighs the situation. Then he makes his decision.

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: Alert the authorities that we'll be departing. With that, Zhao exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zhao moves through his lavish bedroom and into his WALK-I CLOSET. Passing racks of $5,000 suits, he stops at the ba wall -- a PANE OF GLASS looks out onto the skyline below. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Zhao places his hand on the glass causing hidden scanners read his palm print. GREEN BEAMS shoot out from a secret source behind the glass and scan his retinas. Suddenly, the pane of glass reveals itself to be a clever constructed false wall -- it's a 6K LED SCREEN playing a VIDEO IMAGE of the skyline below. A perfect forgery. The LED PANEL opens inward. Zhao steps through it into...

dialogues.speaker: A VAULT
dialogues.text: about the size of a small bathroom. Zhao moves to an old school 1820's FLOOR SAFE and dials in a combination. He cracks it open, pulling the heavy door back to reveal single object inside: A TINY RED MEMORY CARD, the size of thumbnail. Zhao reaches for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tumult as EVACUEES from The Pearl are directed this way a that way by EMERGENCY PERSONNEL. Meanwhile, hundreds of O LOOKERS, cellphones blazing, stare up at The burning Pear an awesome sight, nothing short of a Towering Infernoв„ў. Amidst the chaos we find a ONE-LEGGED HOMELESS MAN, dress in rags and a tattered ball cap, pushing his way through throng in a wheelchair. No one pays him any mind, which i just how Will Ford likes it. Will pauses and looks up at the burning skyscraper above him, the mountain he must climb to rescue his family. The sheer size of it takes his breath away. The task seems impossible. Will's mind races -- there has to be a way. Suddenly he spots the answer. He wheels toward us as we pivot around him to reveal a:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: perched at the very top of an ADJACENT 90-STORY BUILDING still under construction. We hold a beat longer than we might as suddenly XIA STEPS INTO FRAME. She must've spotted Will. She moves after him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the ALCOVE ENTRANCE, a POLICE OFFICER waves the crowd along: keep it movin' people. Nothing to see here. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Will rolls into the alcove in his wheelchair, holding out paper cup, shaking it at him -- begging. The Police Officer scowls, then barks at Will in Chinese. But Will keeps at it shaking the cup. Finally, the asshole cop slaps the cup out of Will's hand and in a blink, Will grabs the man's wrist yanking him do into a vicious head-butt -- CRACK. The cop goes slack. Will catches him before he falls.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Sorry, pal. Next time maybe give a little. Quickly, Will hops up on one leg and swaps places with th police officer, dropping him down into the wheelchair and covering him up with his ball cap and tattered coat. Will places the cup in the cop's lap and pushes him forwa just as a PASSERBY tosses some change into the his cup. WILL (cont'd) Thanks. The English startles the Passerby but he keeps moving. Wi locks the wheelchair in place and pulls out his prostheti leg from the satchel on the chair-back, attaching it. Will pats the cop on the shoulder and moves off inside th building. A beat later, Xia appears in the alcove. She moves to the officer, digging under his hobo jacket a unhooks the RADIO MIC from his shoulder...

dialogues.speaker: XIA
dialogues.text: Shots fired. Shots fired. Officer down. Request immediate back-up. Suspect Will Ford has entered the Scion Capitol building. Armed & dangerous. She presses the barrel of her SILENCED 9MM against the unconscious officer's chest, and pulls the trigger -- THW The officer's body jerks from the impact. Xia picks up th brass cartridge, blowing on it like a lucky penny.  61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flanked by his second-in-command, LIEUTENANT HAN, Captain Chan drinks black tea from a paper cup as he moves throug the Ops Trailer, keeping an eye on a series of MONITORS which play local news broadcasts of the unfolding event.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT HAN
dialogues.text: ...Fire Chief says there's nothing he can do. Water pressure from the trucks can only hit the 30th floor, tops. The system crash shut down the standpipes in the building -- there's no way to get water up high enough.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN CHAN
dialogues.text: So what's he saying?

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT HAN
dialogues.text: He's saying it's gonna burn.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN CHAN
dialogues.text: Get a team to that off-site control facility -- we need those systems back online.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT HAN
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN CHAN
dialogues.text: What about the guy -- Will Ford. What do we know?

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT HAN
dialogues.text: Marine Corps, Bronze Star, FBI for six years, Hostage Rescue Team for eight -- early retirement.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN CHAN
dialogues.text: Early?

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT HAN
dialogues.text: I guess there was an incident.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN CHAN
dialogues.text: What kind of an incident?

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT HAN
dialogues.text: We're not clear on it yet.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN CHAN
dialogues.text: Get clear. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT HAN
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN CHAN
dialogues.text: What about the other guy? The dead one in the bathtub.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT HAN
dialogues.text: Still no ID on him but medical examiner says he was killed eight, maybe ten hours beforehand.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN CHAN
dialogues.text: So you're telling me this one-legged American war hero, travels thirteen thousand miles -- with his wife and kids who no one can seem to locate by the way -- to kill a John Doe this morning, dump the body in his FBI buddy's bathtub before offing him too and then, to kind of round out the evening, decides to light the tallest building in the world on fire? That's where we're at with it?

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT HAN
dialogues.text: That's what it looks Like right now, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN CHAN
dialogues.text: And the attack on the van -- the one that sprung him -- that's part of this?

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT HAN
dialogues.text: Maybe. Maybe not.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN CHAN
dialogues.text: Well I don't know about you Lieutenant, but I think we might win a medal for our police work here. Outstanding stuff. (beat) How 'bout this: is there anything we do know for sure?

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT HAN
dialogues.text: Zhao's leaving his penthouse by helicopter. Got word ten minutes ago.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN CHAN
dialogues.text: Well, thank god the billionaire's safe. (beat) Lieutenant? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT HAN
dialogues.text: Yes, sir?

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN CHAN
dialogues.text: Do me a favor? Go find Will Ford. I'd like to ask him some questions.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT HAN
dialogues.text: Yes, Captain. Lieutenant Han turns to go but...

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN CHAN
dialogues.text: Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT HAN
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN CHAN
dialogues.text: Never mind. Found him. Captain Chan points a large monitor where we see LIVE NEW HELICOPTER FOOTAGE of Will climbing the vertical spire of the super crane FROM THE OUTSIDE. CAPTAIN CHAN (cont'd) Send a strike team. An OPS TECH chimes in...

dialogues.speaker: OPS TECH
dialogues.text: Already there, sir.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: NEWS CHOPPERS circle, blasting Will with their SPOTLIGHTS he works his way, inch-by-inch, up the exterior scaffoldi of the 300-hundred foot tall super crane. ON THE CRANE SPIRE, Will mutters to himself...

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Don't look down...don't look down... Will looks down -- the height is dizzying. His stomach drops. He curses himself... WILL (cont'd) Stupid. Then, at the base of the crane, Will spots: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: THE STRIKE TEAM
dialogues.text: rushing onto the roof, pointing their weapons up at him. Their TEAM LEADER hurries to the crane's ENTRY DOOR as th building's MANAGER unlocks it. The Team Leader throws ope the door and presses the call button for the CRANE CAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-thirds of the way to the top, Will watches as the CRA CAR descends past him. Will can't believe it... WILL (cont'd) Shit. There was an elevator? It's only a matter of moments before the elevator reaches the Strike Team on the roof. No (more) time for jokes, Wi redoubles his efforts, climbing feverishly. Just then, a JET BLACK POLICE HELICOPTER swoops down from the night sky like a bird of prey on the hunt.

dialogues.speaker: ABOARD THE POLICE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: we see a SNIPER, sporting serious-looking night vision goggles, readying his JS 7.62mm bolt-action long gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At last, Will pulls himself up and onto the CONTROL PLATF Exhausted by the effort, Will collapses flat on his back a second, breathing hard. It's eerily quiet up here. Will gets to his feet and looks at The Pearl. He's roughl 110 stories up -- above the fire line, above the park eve Will looks down to the rooftop and sees the STRIKE TEAM boarding the crane car. Will chides himself...

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Great plan, Will. Way to really think this through. Now what, genius? He's got only seconds to do whatever it is he's planning do. Will spots the GLASS-ENCASED CONTROL CAR -- inside it panel of buttons and a joystick that controls the boom ar He moves to it, scanning the area looking for anything to help him break the door handle and gain access. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He spots a nearby TOOL CABINET. He rushes to it, yanking open to reveal a set of tools -- among them a SLEDGEHAMME Will grabs it and rushes back to the Control Car. He's ju about to bludgeon his way in when he thinks better of it and -- what the hell -- tries the door handle. Click. It opens. Will almost laughs. But the sound of the approaching elevator snaps him back into the moment. He rushes over to the platform's ELEVATOR CAGE, grabbing hol of a LENGTH OF CHAIN and a SCREWDRIVER along the way. Will slips the thick chain through a STEEL LOOP on the ELEVATOR CAGE DOOR, securing it with screwdriver. It'll s "em down, but only for so long. Will hurries into the

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL CAR
dialogues.text: where he turns the crane on. After some quick and comedic trial & error and he's got the hang of it. Will rotates the BOOM ARM, swinging it toward The Pearl. Then he EXTENDS toward the face of the building. The cran BEEPS an alert -- it can't extend any further. A THIRTY FOOT GAP remains between the end of the crane and The Pea Will exits the Control Car just as the Strike Team arrive to find themselves locked in. Immediately, they go to wor on the door, trying to break the makeshift chain lock. Time running out, Will grabs the sledgehammer and hustles THE FAR END OF THE CRANE. He stares off the end of the diving board, looking at the building in front of him, calculating something in his mi Will moves back a few paces then charges at us, holding t sledgehammer high and screaming like a medieval warrior.. WILL (cont'd) Ahhh!!! Will HURLS the sledgehammer with all his might -- whoosh! The sledgehammer hurtles through the air, descending gracefully until it strikes the GLASS EXTERIOR of The Pea --CRASH!-- punching through the glass but not shattering sticking there. Will throws up his hands. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: WILL (cont'd) Come on. Really? Clearly, that wasn't the plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire Ops Trailer as well as Captain Chan and Lieutenant Han watch the events unfold in sheer disbelief

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT HAN
dialogues.text: Why the hell would anyone want to get IN to a burning building? Just then, an Ops Tech breaks in, listening to some chatt on his headset.

dialogues.speaker: OPS TECH
dialogues.text: Captain -- word coming in right now -- we have a location on the suspect's family. But Captain Chan already knows the answer...

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN CHAN
dialogues.text: Don't tell me -- they're in the building.

dialogues.speaker: OPS TECH
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will turns from the edge and moves back toward the CONTRO CAR, when he's hit with a WASH OF BLINDING LIGHT. The Police Helicopter drops down, calling out a DISTORTED WARNING IN CHINESE over its loudspeaker as it swings its body broadside. The light peels away from Will revealing the SNIPER hanging out of the bay door. Will's eyes go wide -- BANG! -- a high velocity round cra an inch from his head. Will breaks for it, bolting down t boom arm -- running with everything he's got. The sniper fires again and again but Will's inside the scaffolding structure of the steel arm making the shot nearly impossible as two more rounds ricochet off metal. From directly above, the chopper chases Will down the cra arm's length, firing. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: WHAM -- the elevator door slams open and the Strike Team rushes onto the platform, stopping short at the sight of:

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: running flat out toward the end of the arm, nothing but a thousand foot drop and certain death at the end of it.

dialogues.speaker: THE CROWD BELOW
dialogues.text: inhales collectively as they watch this tiny figure race toward the end of the plank...

dialogues.speaker: WE'RE WITH WILL
dialogues.text: as he runs those final few steps -- no hesitation, no doubt -- to the end of the crane and then -- WHOOSH! -- h LEAPS OFF OF IT, kicking high into the air like an Olympi long jumper. Then... -everything slows down-вЂ” Silence. Wind rushes by our ears as we hang a hundred fee above the fire in the pitch black of night

dialogues.speaker: THE POLICE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: hovers almost directly above Will, fifty feet up; its rot turning in timeless slow motion -- WHOOSH-WHOOSH-WHOOSH. Will begins to fall in a parabolic arc toward The Pearl - toward the window pane with the sledgehammer embedded in Aiming nearly straight down, the Sniper pulls the trigger

dialogues.speaker: CRACK
dialogues.text: The bullet races at Will who's falling toward the window -- the HIGH VELOCITY ROUND RIPS INTO WILL'S LEFT SHOULDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will cries out as the 7.62mm brass tears through flesh an continues onward, piercing the EXTERIOR WINDOW -- shatter it completely -- a split second before Will hits that ver same opening -- THUD! Speed returns as Will slams into the newly-formed window ledge, the impact knocking the wind from his lungs. Glass rains down around him as the sledgehammer falls too its steel head hooking onto the window ledge. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Will falls back but, at the last second, he snatches the sledgehammer handle, dangling there by his one good arm, more than a hundred stories in the air. The crowd below GASPS! The sledgehammer starts to slide loose quickly. Will has choice but to use his other hand -- his injured arm. He throws it up there, grabbing hold of the window's ledg just as the sledgehammer dislodges, falling away. Will hangs by his damaged arm. Enduring ungodly pain, he manages to get his good arm on the ledge. Using both arms now, Will pulls himself inside the building. He made it.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GROUND
dialogues.text: the crowd goes WILD -- a folk hero is born.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE PEARL
dialogues.text: No celebration. No quips. Exhausted, Will drags himself t his feet and staggers off into the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the boardroom, Zhao and the others watch in astonishme

dialogues.speaker: MR. PIERCE
dialogues.text: What the hell's he doing?

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: Apparently, whatever it takes. Dov enters and gives Zhao a look. ZHAO (cont'd) If you'll excuse me, please. Zhao exits as Mr. Pierce and the suits watch the news unfold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dov and Zhao step out of the boardroom, settling in. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DOV
dialogues.text: McManus is instrument-rated, it's not his day job, but he's more than qualified to fly us out of here. I sent him up to get the bird ready.

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: Excellent. But Dov's face betrays him -- he's not saying something. ZHAO (cont'd) Is that it?

dialogues.speaker: DOV
dialogues.text: Sir, I've worked for you for nearly eight years now. In that time, I believe I've shown myself to be trustworthy and more than capable...

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: What's on your mind, Dov?

dialogues.speaker: DOV
dialogues.text: Sir -- I can't protect you if you don't tell me what's going on. This isn't a fire, this is a plot -- and I need some answers. Zhao knows his body man is right.

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: I can't say for sure.

dialogues.speaker: DOV
dialogues.text: I don't need facts. What's your gut telling you? Who's behind this? That name hits Dov hard.

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: Wu-Sai Jun.

dialogues.speaker: DOV
dialogues.text: Triads?

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: Black Lotus.

dialogues.speaker: DOV
dialogues.text: I don't understand, if the Black Lotus wanted you dead, there are easier ways. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: They don't want me dead -- they want this. Zhao pulls out the RED MEMORY CARD. Just then...

dialogues.speaker: MR. PIERCE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Can we go? Zhao quickly pockets the memory card. But Mr. Pierce cloc it and senses that's he's interrupted a secret moment...

dialogues.speaker: MR. PIERCE
dialogues.text: Is there something I should know?

dialogues.speaker: DOV
dialogues.text: Yes -- the helicopter's ready. Dov moves off, but Mr. Pierce isn't feeling too comfortab about whatever it was he just witnessed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flanked by Dov and his security detail, Zhao, Mr. Pierce, the suits approach the grand DOUBLE DOORS to his penthous Zhao places a palm on a wall-mounted HAND-SCANNER. The titanium double doors swing open. They exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zhao and the posse move away from the penthouse's double step on to a PRIVATE ELEVATOR. The doors close. It goes u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bizarrely, Will finds himself on a floor filled with LUXU STORES -- a high-end shopping mall in the sky. Bleeding on the imported Emperador marble floor, Will staggers past CARTIER, GUCCI and TOM FORD -- all closed. spots an abandoned JANITOR'S CART up ahead. He rushes to Will digs through the cart, looking for anything that mig help him. Quickly, he finds a roll of DUCT TAPE and a bottle of RUBBING ALCOHOL. Will inspects his gunshot wound: a grisly quarter-sized h in the meat of his shoulder. Not good. He rips his shirt sleeve off and rolls the fabric into a short tube. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Will unscrews the rubbing alcohol and dumps it onto his wound -- the sudden pain hits him like a wave. Will brace himself against the wall to keep from doubling over. A breath, then Will thumbs the rolled fabric into his wou end-first. The pain is enormous, but the deed is done. Th wound has been packed. Will grabs the duct tape.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: If you can't fix it with duct tape... He winds it twice around the meat of his shoulder, tearin the tape with his teeth, securing the ad hoc bandage snug WILL (cont'd) ...then you aren't using enough duct tape. Will tests his arm. He can move it, but it hurts like a bitch when he does. It'll have to do. Will loops the duct tape to his belt and moves to the INN ATRIUM to get his bearings. All of the elevators are off- line due to the fire. NEWS COVERAGE plays on an in-wall T SCREEN -- from the looks of it, the fire is about to reac the park. Will talks to himself... WILL (cont'd) I'll find you. Just hang on. Will moves to the STAIRWELL DOOR, throwing it open only t stagger back as he's struck with a blast of heat and smok Will tears his other sleeve off, tying the fabric around face. He gathers himself and enters the

dialogues.speaker: STAIRWELL
dialogues.text: which is choked black by smoke. Will spots a RED EMERGENC BOX with a WOODEN PICK-HEAD AX inside. A sharp elbow is a it takes as Will grabs hold of a three-foot FIREMAN'S AX. He descends into the smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zhao's LUXURY HELICOPTER sits inside this two-story, glas walled, hangar in the sky. Then the GLASS WALLS slide apart like as the ENTIRE SECTI of glossy showroom floor that the helicopter rests on extends into the night sky like a plank on a pirate ship. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The rotors start to spin as the PILOT preps for take off. Zhao and the others exit the elevator onto the hangar flo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AN HKF ASSAULT TEAM moves through the open gate, clocking the dead bodies in the guard shack. They approach the low-slung concrete building, stacking u by the door. The BREACHER uses his METAL RAM to knock the doorknob straight through like a Whack-A-Mole -- THUNK! The Team yanks the door open and rushes in tripping an INFRARED BEAM and triggering the BLACK BRICK booby trap. KA-BOOM. A bone-rattling explosion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chaos. Phones ring, people shout as word of the explosion pours in. Captain Chan takes it all in with a grave calm. Lieutenant Han approaches, handing him a print out.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT HAN
dialogues.text: Got positive ID on the JD in the bathtub.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN CHAN
dialogues.text: Who is he?

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT HAN
dialogues.text: Sanjit Singh. Insurance executive for Hawthorne/Stone, the company underwriting The Pearl. Chan puzzles over this new piece of information as we...

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: standing in the penthouse hangar. He rolls up his shirtsleeve, revealing a FAMILIAR LOOKING TATTOO. We're..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter's rotors at speed, the pilot signals for Z and the others to approach. Zhao moves forward but Dov stops him short -- something isn't right. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DOV
dialogues.text: Hang on --

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: DOV
dialogues.text: -- The pilot. He's not ours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce turns to Zhao and pulls the trigger just as Dov tackles his boss out of the way, catching a round. The BAY DOORS on the helicopter are thrown open revealing FIVE MEN in BLACK TACTICAL GEAR -- the very same suspicio men we last saw on Sarah's floor, including the guy with Samurai topknot, now called FENG. Instantly, it's a fire-fight. Pierce and his five men wit sub-machine guns versus Dov and his three men with handgu Caught in the crossfire, the suits are quickly dropped by the assailants as Dov and his squad take cover. Hunkered down with Zhao behind a METAL TOOL CHEST, Dov po up and clips a bad guy, causing him to fall off of the HELIPAD PLANK, screaming as he heads all the way down. Dov drops down, slapping in a fresh magazine. DOV (cont'd) When I tell you, run for the elevator. Zhao nods. Dov pops up and jerks his aim toward

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: where he unloads eight shots through the windshield, stitching the pilot in the chest. The pilot slumps forwar onto the controls CAUSING THE HELICOPTER TO LIFT AND TILT TOWARD THE HANGAR -- it only takes a split second for the blades to catch the helipad plank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An unholy shriek of metal as the copter's body is whipsaw toward the glass walls of the penthouse hangar. DOV (cont'd) Go!-- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: --BANG! Dov's voice is choked off as he's plugged in the chest courtesy of Pierce. Shocked, Zhao takes off running... +..just as the 20-ton helicopter SMASHES THROUGH THE HANG WINDOWS: an indoor crash-landing 220 stories above the ea Zhao reaches the elevator just as the chopper EXPLODES IN FLAMES; shrapnel flies as Pierce and his men take cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd reacts to the explosion near the top of The Pea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chan and his team watch the explosion on their monitors. Lieutenant Han holds out a phone...

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT HAN
dialogues.text: Sir...

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN CHAN
dialogues.text: Not now.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT HAN
dialogues.text: It's the Chief Executive. The air sucks out of the room. Captain Chan takes the phone...

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN CHAN
dialogues.text: Good evening, your Honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce spots Zhao disappearing in his private elevator. H shouts at his men as he hurries toward the STAIRWELL DOOR slamming through it, racing to cut off Zhao's escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator opens and Zhao bolts for his penthouse doors slapping his hand on the palm reader. Click -- the heavy doors open just as Pierce barrels thro the adjacent stairwell door, gun blazing -- BANG-BANG-BAN (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Zhao slips through the narrow opening -- as Pierce's roun spark and ping off the doors. Zhao slams the EMERGENCY CLOSE button. The titanium doors shut on Pierce's face, locking him out.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND THE TITANIUM DOORS
dialogues.text: Zhao breathes hard -- shaken. He reaches into his suit an pulls out the RED MEMORY CARD, staring at it in relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce curses his luck. His remaining five men arrive. Furious, Pierce snatches a RADIO MIC off of one of them.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Open the penthouse doors!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Xia sitting at a street cafe a block from The Pearl touch her ear. [INTERCUT AS NECESSARY]

dialogues.speaker: XIA
dialogues.text: Standby. She opens Will's laptop, logging into The Pearl's control systems. She selects the penthouse but can't affect it -- she's locked out of its controls. Not good. XIA (cont'd) The penthouse isn't linked to the building's control system. He's got his own subsystem for his floor. I can't drive it -- I'm locked out. Pierce fumes, then doubles down.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Kill the power to the upper half. Cell tower too. All of it. Go dark. With a few clever keystrokes Xia cuts the power to the to half of The Pearl and disables its internal cell tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gathered crowd OOHS & AAHS as suddenly the top half o The Pearl goes out like a Christmas Tree getting unplugge  76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zhao's penthouse is thrown into darkness. Emergency light CHUNK ON. He pulls out his cellphone: no signal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing at the titanium doors, Pierce looks at his team.

dialogues.speaker: FENG
dialogues.text: How do we get in?

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: We can't. But I know someone who can. And he happens to be in the building.

dialogues.speaker: FENG
dialogues.text: The American? But we don't know where he is.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: We don't have to know where he is -- we know what he wants. All we need to do is get to them first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah and the kids kneel by the stream in the park. Georgia, still sporting a soiled Panda hoodie, re-wets th towels in the ersatz lake. Henry coughs from smoke inhalation -- an asthma attack taking hold.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: It's okay, baby. Just slow down. Slow down and breathe. In for three, out for three. Sarah gives him two hits from the inhaler and helps Henry calm his breathing, trying to get his attack under contro The MUFFLED ROAR of the unchecked blaze GROWLS from below leviathan rising. Sarah's worried. SARAH (cont'd) Okay, we gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIA
dialogues.text: Why? There's water here. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: It's not safe.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: How do you know-- BOOM! -- a FIRE DOOR on the far end of the park rockets o its hinges as flames reach through the new opening.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Run! Sarah hustles her kids through the park as from all angle the fire begins to claw its way into the floor. Fire breaks through the seams in the sod -- ZIG-ZAGGING through the grass like snakes, chasing Sarah and the kids They rush for a STAIRWELL DOOR just as it EXPLODES LIKE A PIPE BOMB. They duck as the door WHIZZES overhead shearin through a METAL LAMPPOST behind them. Sarah grabs her kids and yanks them in the other directio pushing them toward their only escape: THE INNER ATRIUM. Henry struggles. Sarah picks him up, carrying her son, as the trio rush across

dialogues.speaker: THE SKY BRIDGE,
dialogues.text: a narrow footbridge with a glass canopy that spans the diameter of the INNER ATRIUM. From above, we watch as Sarah and the kids race across th sky bridge; the world below them filled with ash and fire glowing like the mouth of a volcano.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE FAR SIDE OF THE BRIDGE
dialogues.text: they find respite -- this part of the park hasn't been consumed by fire yet. Sarah puts Henry down, spotting another STAIRWELL DOOR on the opposite wall. She's about make for it when, suddenly, it opens revealing FENG. The guy doesn't miss a beat -- he smiles warmly...

dialogues.speaker: FENG
dialogues.text: Hey! We've been looking everywhere for you guys. Sarah exhales -- relieved. Then Feng speaks into his mic. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: FENG (cont'd) Got 'em. They're in the park. Something about his tone catches Sarah, she doesn't like

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Mom -- is that a fireman?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I don't know, honey. (calling out) Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: FENG
dialogues.text: Building security. We met earlier, remember? Feng continues walking, closing the gap between them as Sarah subtly moves in front of her children. FENG (cont'd) You need to come with us now -- the building's not safe, we're evacuating. Feng reaches for Sarah, she steps back.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I want to see your ID.

dialogues.speaker: FENG
dialogues.text: Miss -- please. We don't have time.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You work for the building -- ID. Feng's jaw tightens.

dialogues.speaker: FENG
dialogues.text: Fine. You got it. He reaches to his belt and pulls out his H&K COMBAT PISTO FENG (cont'd) Let's go, bitch. Sarah's face falls. Feng grabs her, spinning her and wrapping a big forearm around her neck. FENG (cont'd) Kids too. Henry and Georgia start to tear up... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: It's okay -- it's okay, guys. Just do what he says. Surreptitiously, Sarah slides her hands into her front pant's pocket, pulling out the pair of CHROME SCISSORS.

dialogues.speaker: FENG
dialogues.text: Listen to your mommy ki--AHHH! Sarah stabs Feng in the upper thigh -- he cries out -- an flips him over her shoulder in a slick judo move.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Run! Henry and Georgia take off running back across the sky bridge, as Sarah dives for Feng's H&K, snatching it up an turning back just in time to take a boot to the mouth. Sarah goes sprawling as Feng rises, yanking the scissors from his leg and tossing them aside. He picks up his pist but tucks it away and pulls out a TACTICAL KNIFE, spinnin it menacingly -- he's gonna do this old school. Sarah gets to her feet, unarmed and out-muscled. Easy prey in front of him, Feng attacks. But Sarah is mor than he bargained for as she side-steps his swing, blocki his knife arm expertly before kicking his knee out. Feng goes down hard, howling. Sarah turns and takes off running back across the sky bridge.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE PARK
dialogues.text: Holding hands, Henry and Georgia find themselves in the middle of a legitimate forest fire. In all the smoke and madness, they get turned around quickly -- burning trees everywhere. Henry starts coughing harshly, letting go of his sister's hand. And that's when a MASSIVE PIECE OF CEILING COLLAPSE Henry and Georgia dive out of the way just as the section smashes between them through up smoke and fire. Like a pilot in the fog, Henry gets turned around -- he can't see Georgia any more. He calls out for her. Nothing Unsure, he picks a direction and heads that way, calling for his sister.

dialogues.speaker: DOWN A WALK PATH
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Henry comes toward us, coughing madly and calling out for Georgia. He doubles over at a PARK BENCH, trying to catch his breath. He's alone and terrified. And that's when he spots Sarah running across the bridge toward him.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Mom! Henry takes off running toward her.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SKY BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Sarah races toward the far end when suddenly a BURNING TR from the park falls, crashing through the Inner Atrium gl wall and SLICING THROUGH THE SKY BRIDGE IN ONE CLEAN STRO A HAIL OF HOT EMBERS explodes as the END OF THE BRIDGE dr at a sharp angle, nearly taking Sarah with it. She turns back to see Feng hobbling toward her. He tucks away his knife and pulls his H&K. No more games. She's trapped. Sarah takes a step back, her heels dancing on the edge of the broken bridge and a fall to her death.

dialogues.speaker: FENG
dialogues.text: I wasn't supposed to kill you -- but I don't give a shit anymore. He's about to pull the trigger when suddenly his face goe slack. Then blood cascades down his chin and he face-plan to reveal a FIREMAN'S AX in his back and

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: standing there, ten feet behind him, having hurled the blade. Sarah rushes to him, they embrace.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I'm fine -- how did you get here?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Tell you later -- we gotta get the kids.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: They're back in the park. Will nods breaking into action -- he dislodges his ax and goes to snag Feng's gun when... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BBBRAAAAT
dialogues.text: GUNFIRE rains down on the GLASS CANOPY of the sky bridge, shattering it. Two of Pierce's MEN three floors up unload Will grabs Sarah's hand as they take off toward the open of the bridge through the maelstrom, exiting:

dialogues.speaker: INTO THE FAR SIDE OF THE PARK
dialogues.text: which has itself begun to burn. Will and Sarah hug the curve of the INNER ATRIUM wall, circling around counter- clockwise back toward the blocked end of the sky bridge..

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Mom! Dad! There's Henry -- he was circling around clockwise toward them. Will and Sarah kneel down, hugging their son.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Where's Georgia?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I don't know! We got split up -- she's back in the park somewhere. Will and Sarah share a look -- they know how grave that i

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: I'll find her. We gotta get you guys outta here first -- they're coming down for us.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Will -- what the hell is going on? Who are they?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: I don't know yet. The only thing that matters to me right now is getting you out of here. Will's eyes land on a nearby Inner Atrium Elevator. WILL (cont'd) Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lost and frightened, Georgia moves through the park. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She calls out for her mother and brother but, with the ro of the fire, her cries are quickly swallowed up. She spots a GLASS STAIRCASE cut into the exterior window wall of the building itself -- a tourist attraction featu BOOM! A FIERY SINKHOLE suddenly opens up in front of Georgia, the ground beneath her feet eroding. She back pedals from its lip and bolts for the glass staircase. Just as she disappears, we land on the TWO GUNMEN we last saw shooting at the skyway bridge. They spotted Georgia.

dialogues.speaker: GUNMAN
dialogues.text: (into mic) We got the girl. He nods to his buddy, they move for the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah and Henry are in the car, Will stands outside it.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I'm not doing this--

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Henry can't stay in this building -- there's too much smoke. You know that. Whoever those guys are, they're serious. The only safe place for you both is on the ground. Will finds a WALL PANEL and cleaves it open with his ax revealing a complex array of cables and wiring. He digs through the cabling as he talks... WILL (cont'd) These elevators are Mag-Lev -- they work on electromagnetic induction. But in the event of a power failure, they're held in place by a hydraulic fail-safe brake. (beat) The power's out from the midpoint of the building on up -- but it's still on below the fire line. Once I cut the hydraulic cable, you'll fall.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: will-- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Listen to me -- you'll fall through the fire and hit electricity again -- the magnets will kick back on and stop you. You'll be traveling too fast for the flames to matter. Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I'm not leaving you --

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: You're not leaving me, you're saving Henry. (beat) It's almost 1,000 feet from here to the fire line. That'll take you about nine seconds. Count to ten and then pull this emergency stop handle -- okay?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What about Georgia?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: I'll find her. I promise. It's a solemn vow. And Sarah knows it's the only way. She kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: I love you too. Will hugs Henry. WILL (cont'd) I need you to be strong buddy -- take care of Mom, okay? Can you do that for me?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Good. It's gonna be scary, but you'll be fine. Just hold on and count backwards from ten, okay? Henry hits his inhaler and nods. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Daddy loves who?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Me.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: That's right. Will hugs his boy, kissing his forehead. WILL (cont'd) Step back. They move back into the elevator, sitting down on the flo Will lines up his ax blade on a THICK YELLOW HYDRAULIC CA Will and Sarah lock eyes -- a look of love and strength between them. Then Will steps into a home run swing -- THWACK!-- a clean cut. Instantly the car plummets -- Sarah's SCREAM Dopplers awa as they disappear in a blink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ELEVATOR roars past us at 170 MPH -- a complete, stomach-dropping, free fall.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE ELEVATOR
dialogues.text: WARNING ALARMS BLARE as Sarah holds Henry in a bear hug o the elevator floor -- the world coming apart around them. They count backwards together: ten...nine...eight... The CARRIAGE SHAKES AND SHUDDERS as a staccato of light strobes the glass car -- fire then smoke, then fire again A descent into Hell itself. Seven...six...five... The elevator glass SHATTERS from the unbridled G-Force. Four...three... The centripetal force pinning her, Sarah reaches for the EMERGENCY HANDLE, fingers dancing across it but not quite

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: -Two...ONE! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She yanks the handle. Nothing happens. They keep falling. Sarah yanks the handle again -- then a loud CHUNKING nois as she's slammed to the floor, a SHOWER OF SPARKS explode all around the car. Finally the carriage chokes to a stop Sarah looks at Henry -- the boy smiles. They made it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With its kitchen a concentric circle around the inner atrium, this fancy-ass restaurant offers up stunning 360В views of the Hong Kong skyline. The priciest meal in town What's more, the floor itself is comprised of GLASS PANEL offering up views of the park below. With the fire raging unchecked, the setting is lit with an unearthly orange gl We find Georgia standing in the middle of the space, breathing hard. Panic setting in. She hears a noise and spins to see the two GUNMEN rushing up from the stairs. Instinctively, Georgia ducks -- hiding a split second bef the men arrive on the scene. The Gunmen scan the restaurant. They know she's here. Gunman #1 motions to his partner, they split apart, stalk through the Michelin-rated finery.

dialogues.speaker: GUNMAN
dialogues.text: It's okay -- we're the good guys. You can come out now, you're safe.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIA,
dialogues.text: hiding under a table, is anything but convinced. She spot a STEAK KNIFE on the setting above her. She sneaks her fingers up to snag it -- her hand disappearing just as Gunman #2's eyes sweep that exact sp The Gunmen close in on her location, tossing over tables they go. Closer and closer to her hiding spot. Tension squeezes us like a vice as Gunman #2 stops in front of Georgia's table.

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE TABLE
dialogues.text: Georgia dare not breathe. She clutches her steak knife an spies Gunman #2's foot right in front of her. The young girl screws up her courage and drives the knife home. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Gunman #2 ROARS. Georgia bolts from cover. Gunman #2 FIRES -- but his pained shots are wild, lighting up glassware and cutlery all around Georgia as she dives beh the CIRCULAR KITCHEN WALL against the inner atrium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, searching feverishly in the fire, hears the gun sho from above. He spots the glass staircase and breaks for i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gunman #1 grabs Gunman #2's carbine, jerking it aside.

dialogues.speaker: GUNMAN
dialogues.text: We need her alive! She's the bait.

dialogues.speaker: GUNMAN
dialogues.text: She fuckin' stabbed me!

dialogues.speaker: GUNMAN
dialogues.text: Get over it. He motions and the pair split up again -- each taking opposite entry points into

dialogues.speaker: THE CIRCULAR KITCHEN AREA
dialogues.text: where Georgia crawls on all fours, staying low. She opens low STAINLESS STEEL CABINET and crawls inside, shutting i The hunters stalk their prey slowly, opening each cabinet they go -- it's only a matter of time. In the small darkness, Georgia begins to cry, terrified. Gunman #2 throws open Georgia's cabinet, revealing her.

dialogues.speaker: GUNMAN
dialogues.text: Found you, you little shit. You're gonna pay for what you-- WHAM! Out of nowhere, Will freight trains him, sending Gunman #2 smashing him against the inner atrium glass.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: (to Georgia) Go! She does as Will turns his focus to Gunman #2 who fires a point blank range. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: But Will side-steps the shots, grabbing the muzzle and stitching the atrium glass panel with them before kicking Gunman #2 in the back, sending him through the panel and down to the first floor the hard way. Will pivots just as Gunman #1 opens fire on him. Will duc as pots and pans dance and pinwheel overhead. Gunman #1 goes dry and reloads allowing Will to grab a CA IRON SKILLET and, using it like a medieval shield, charge Caught between reloads, Gunman #1 jerks his sidearm and unloads into the iron plate, but Will is already on top o him -- the beat down is merciless. Will's about to end it when he hears...

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Enough! Will turns to see Pierce standing there, holding Georgia, pistol to her head. All the fight goes out of him. For a moment, Will's confused -- the last time he saw Pie was in Zhao's penthouse boardroom. Quickly though, Will puts together the double-cross. His eyes narrow. Then he looks to his frightened daughter and reassures her...

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: It's gonna be okay, honey. The Gangster gets to his feet and drives the stock of his weapon viciously into Will's gut, dropping the big man to his knees -- Will never takes his eyes off Georgia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Chan moves down the length of the trailer, headin for the door, flanked by Lieutenant Han...

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT HAN
dialogues.text: The Night Tigers are military -- counter-terror.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN CHAN
dialogues.text: I'm aware of that, Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT HAN
dialogues.text: But this isn't an act of terrorism. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN CHAN
dialogues.text: That's not how the his honor sees it. He sees an expertly-trained foreign national, wanted for murder, on the loose inside that building preparing to do god-knows-what. He's not going to take any chances.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT HAN
dialogues.text: And you agree with him?

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN CHAN
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter if I agree with him. It's happening. Chan exits...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Lieutenant Han follows.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT HAN
dialogues.text: Captain...

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN CHAN
dialogues.text: There's nothing I can do. We've got thirty minutes to resolve this scenario or it becomes a military operation and we're on the sideline. So unless someone can tell me something different is going on inside of that building, they're gonna use a broadsword on it. Then:

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Sir... Chan turns to see: an OFFICER standing there with SARAH A HENRY, dirty, blanketed, but alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce holds Georgia at gunpoint. The young girl whimpers and shakes, tears rolling down her face, scared for her life. Flanked by Pierce's three remaining men, Will is on his knees, his hands zip-tied behind him. Will does his best to console his daughter... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Honey -- look at me. Look at my eyes. Everything's going to be alright. I promise. You hear me? Panicked, Georgia can only nod her head yes. WILL (cont'd) I love you, sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIA
dialogues.text: (shaking) I love you too, Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: I'm afraid I'm going to have to interrupt. Will glares. If a look could kill, Pierce would be toe-up

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: The dead man in Horace's bathtub -- Singh -- that was you?

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: No -- that was your pal. That's the nice thing about dealing with degenerate gamblers, they'll do anything to pay a debt. Even sell out their dearest friend. Now -- you still haven't answered my question.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: I already told you: the only way that door opens is if Zhao opens it from his side or if this floor's fire alarm triggers it -- but that can't happen because you guys took the entire system offline. You understand? It can't be done.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Nonsense. Anything can be done with the proper motivation. So let me help. You're gonna get in there and you're gonna bring Zhao, and what he's holding, to me or I'm gonna throw your daughter off the fucking roof. Pierce grabs Georgia's arm, shaking her sharply. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: PIERCE (cont'd) I hear it's like heaven up there.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIA
dialogues.text: Daddy! Will lunges to his feet, charging at Pierce. One of Pierc MEN cracks him on the skull, sending him to the floor. Will coughs and writhes, his eyes watering. Pierce shoves Georgia to one of his men, then he moves over to Will, kneeling down to cut his zip tied hands, smirking as he d

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Tick-tock... Pierce grabs Georgia by the hair and yanks her toward the STAIRWELL EXIT DOOR. The girl yells for her father -- Wil reaches out for Georgia from the ground, a futile gesture Pierce and his men disappear through the STAIRWELL EXIT. His daughter's cries cut short as the door seals shut. Will gets to his feet, shaking out the cobwebs. He moves the stairwell door, trying it with no luck -- it's locked He starts pacing, muttering to himself, his mind racing..

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Come on, Will...think...think... Will moves to an exterior-facing TWENTY-FOOT WIDE PANORAM WINDOW, its CURTAINS drawn back like an elegant movie hou to reveal the skyline and fire raging five floors below. He spots an in-wall FIRE ALARM BOX -- its digital display flashes: OFFLINE. Will pulls the handle a couple times, nothing. He's fucked. Will tries to pry the Fire Alarm box off the wall, to get its innards, but without any luck. It's on there tight. It's then that Will spots something on the other side of panoramic window... WILL (cont'd) Hello, beautiful. Sitting directly opposite the fire alarm, on the exterior the building, is its CONTROL BOX resting there on the exposed fascia. He spots a METAL TRASH CAN and picks it u (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Will slams the trash can against the panoramic window -- CLANG! Nothing. A chip maybe. Will tries again, no luck. WILL (cont'd) Damn it. Will moves down the PANORAMIC WINDOW, away from the FIRE ALARM until he comes to the window's end. He stops at an ADJACENT PANEL OF GLASS, just as tall but only about four-feet wide -- an easier target. Will presses on it with his hand, judging its thickness. Knowing now what it takes now, Will backs up and then charges: using the trash can like a battering ram -- WHAM

dialogues.speaker: INSTANTLY THE WHOLE SECTION SHATTERS INTO A MILLION PIECE
dialogues.text: and Will's momentum carries him THROUGH THE OPENING!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lets go of the trash can, barely managing to grab hold the WINDOW TRANSOM to keep from falling through completel Will gathers himself and scans the penthouse level. His eyes land on a BRONZE STATUE of a CHINESE WARRIOR resting a four-foot MARBLE PEDESTAL. He shoulders the pedestal sending the statue crashing. Th Warrior's HAND breaks free and in it a SIX-INCH SHORT-SWO ("Dao"). Will picks up the thin blade -- it'll do. He looks at the CURTAINS hanging to one side of the panoramic window. He yanks them down, quickly finding the BRAIDED CORD that the mechanism uses to retract them. Wil loops the cord around his elbow like a length of rope. Finished, Will knows he's still missing one more thing. H reaches for his belt and holds up the DUCT TAPE.

dialogues.speaker: WILL'S HANDS
dialogues.text: wrapped like a boxer's before a bout but with duct tape, STICKY SIDE OUT. Will finishes the last strip and tests h new hand adhesion by placing his palms together.

dialogues.speaker: THE MARBLE PEDESTAL
dialogues.text: lying on its side at the foot of the shattered window pan One end of the curtain rope is tied around its the pedest the other end Will lashes around his waist, knotting it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: We see that Will has also duct taped his feet. He checks the stickiness of one, talking to himself... WILL (cont'd) Can never be too careful when you're doing something this stupid. Standing at the open window, the wind howling madly, noth but a three-thousand foot fall and certain death below hi Will steadies himself... WILL (cont'd) Kids, don't try this at home... ...and then he steps out, pivoting around the window transom. But his first step is a poorly place one and Wil stumbles, nearly falling. HE CLUTCHES THE TRANSOM AND PULLS HIMSELF BACK IN -- his life flashing before his eyes. Will lets out a little laugh -- nerves getting the better of him. Two steadying breaths and Will gives it another go. He pivots out stepping onto the SIX-INCH LEDGE that runs along the base of the panoramic window. Will presses his body as close as he can to the glass -- his duct taped ha sticking nicely to the window. Slide step by slide step, Will crosses the twenty-foot wi section of glass, eyeing the CONTROL BOX on the far side. Below him, the fire rages -- climbing ever-closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Being tended to by an EMT, Henry breaths through an oxyge mask as nearby Sarah sketches something for Chan.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: It looked like this... Sarah flips around a clipboard to reveal a crude facsimil of the Black Lotus Triad tattoo. Chan and Han share a knowing look.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN CHAN
dialogues.text: And how many of them did you say you saw?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Six. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN CHAN
dialogues.text: Do you have any idea what they're doing up there? Why they're doing this?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT HAN
dialogues.text: And you claim your husband isn't involved?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I don't claim that -- I'm telling you that. He's not involved. Lieutenant Han pulls his boss away for an aside, speaking Cantonese.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT HAN
dialogues.text: Captain -- this doesn't pass the smell test. None of it does. If the Black Lotus are there to get something -- to steal something -- why light the building on fire? And if they're trying to cover their tracks -- fine -- but why trap yourself above the fire line and then destroy your only means of escape? It doesn't make any sense. A sudden realization hits Sarah. She cuts in in Cantonese surprising the officers.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: That's not their only means of escape.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT HAN
dialogues.text: Really? Then how are they planning to get out?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: They're gonna jump.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT HAN
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: They're gonna jump off the top. When I saw them that first time, they had containers with them marked in Russian. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sarah grabs a computer terminal. Types in the word for PARACHUTE then hits translate to Russian.

dialogues.speaker: TIAPAMOT
dialogues.text: Pops up. She points at it. SARAH (cont'd) That's the word I saw on the container they had. Sarah moves to a WALL MAP of HONG KONG, scanning it. SARAH (cont'd) (to Han) Gimme your pen. The lieutenant hesitates, looking to Chan for the okay.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN CHAN
dialogues.text: Give her your pen... He obliges and Sarah snags it, checking its length agains the map's scale legend. She marks an X on the map.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: The Pearl is here. (beat) A base jump from a thousand meters up gives you about triple that in lateral descent distance -- call ita mile to be safe, two pen lengths.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT HAN
dialogues.text: How do you know that? She turns her phone's screen to them and shrugs...

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I Googled it. The Captain shoots his Lieutenant a look: she got you the Sarah measures out two pen lengths from the X in all four directions, then connects the points with a crude circle. SARAH (cont'd) That's your search area. If they land, they'll land within that circle -- and if they have friends, they'll be waiting to pick them up at the landing zone. Someplace flat and open. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Impressed, Captain Chan moves closer to the map... Sarah points

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN CHAN
dialogues.text: And secluded. (scanning the map) They won't go for Victoria Park -- too obvious and too many trees to get hung up on. South, but you'd never clear the peak. West, maybe, but it's a longer haul to an open spot. Risky.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: There. What's that -- on the other side of the harbor? The Kowloon side. to a BROWN RECTANGLE in the water.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT HAN
dialogues.text: That's nothing. It's a construction sand barge -- bay dredge. Sarah gives Chan a look. He's thinking. LIEUTENANT HAN (cont'd) Captain, you can't seriously be considering this. For all we know, she's in on it.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You think I'd willingly trap my own children in a burning building?

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT HAN
dialogues.text: I think you could be playing a role. You could be a distraction to allow your husband to escape. This could all be part of his plan. Sarah can't believe this guy. She turns to Chan...

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Captain, I know you wanna get this right and the last thing you want to do is to point your gun at the wrong guy. (beat) Take me out to the sand barge. If it's empty and I'm wrong, what have you lost? But if I'm right, it might be your only chance to catch the men responsible for this whole thing. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Captain Chan considers this. He's about to respond when suddenly there's a RUMBLING FROM THE CROWD OUTSIDE. Something's going on. Chan breaks for the trailer's exit door, followed by Lieutenant Han and Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trio come to a stop just outside the trailer. They stare at the HD BILLBOARD, stunned. ON SCREEN, we see long-lens news footage of Will inching across the PANORAMIC WINDOW, nearly a mile above them. They turn from the giant video screen and look up with th own eyes to see Will's ant-like form, clinging to the sid the building -- an insane act. The act of a desperate man

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Captain, does that look like someone with a plan to you? Chan glances at Sarah -- his wheels turning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 220 stories above the earth, Will presses himself against the glass, inches from his goal. One more step. Will makes the step --BOOM!-- a glass panel on the floor below him explodes like a car bomb. Will lunges for the control box, clutching it to keep fro falling. Two more explosions rock the tower from below. Will finds footing around the box. He reaches into his waistband and pulls out the statue's sword, wedging it in the seams of the box, prying at it. With a crack, it pops open and Will goes to work on the wiring. He finds what he's looking for -- a GOLD WIRE. Using the statue sword, Will strips the wire, cuts anothe one, and hot-wires them together. A GREEN LIGHT on the conduit panel turns off and a RED LIGHT starts FLASHING.

dialogues.speaker: THE FIRE ALARM BOX
dialogues.text: on the other side of the panoramic window flashes the wor FIRE-FIRE-FIRE.  97.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CONTROL PANEL next to the PENTHOUSE DOORS flashes the same: FIRE-FIRE-FIRE. With a heavy metal CHUNK, the TITANIUM DOORS UNLOCK AND SLOWLY START TO SWING OPEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The panel by Zhao's bed blinks: FIRE-FIRE-FIRE. Zhao pull open his nightstand drawer snatches up a PALM-SIZED BERET NANO -- an executive's gun meant to be concealed. Zhao exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zhao rounds the corner to see the front doors to his penthouse wide open. He moves to the nearest control pane and tries to shut the doors, but the programming won't al it -- the fire alarm overrides his controls. Thinking fast, Zhao pulls his smartphone out of his pocke snags a nearby USB cable and plugs his phone directly int the panel itself. He starts thumbing away like mad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will lets go of the control box and begins to make his wa back across the panoramic window, slide step by sli -- BO A DEAFENING EXPLOSION rattles the world. Will falls. Everything goes topsy-turvy as we plummet. Suddenly, we'r jerked to stop as Will's securing rope snaps taught. That's the good news. The bad news is that the sudden force of the fall has cau Will's securing rope to slip down his body -- coming to a snug cinch point around the ankle of Will's prosthetic le Fire raging around him, Will dangles upside down by his ankle, a mile up, like a rabbit caught in a rope snare.

dialogues.speaker: THE MARBLE PEDESTAL
dialogues.text: is yanked against the window frame at a poor angle, wedgi itself against the transom in anything but a secure fashi (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Swinging upside down, Will gets his bearings. He tries to curl his body up toward the rope -- like a hanging sit-up but the added strain of the move causes his prosthetic sleeve to loosen -- WILL'S LEG IS SLIPPING OUT OF IT. Will falls back, dangling by a leg that's coming loose. Like a car teetering on the edge of a cliff, any movement from Will might cause his leg to come undone completely. The earth a postage stamp below him, Will steadies himsel becoming as still as possible, barely daring to breathe. Will knows he's going to have one shot at this. He gather his courage and makes one sharp move. With a grunt, he breaks into action using his free leg to kick off the face of the building while throwing his hand toward his toes, propelling himself upward with such forc that his RESIDUAL LIMB POPS OUT OF THE PROSTHESIS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a blink, Will is in complete free fall -- no rope, no leg -- but his hands snag hold of the CARBON FIBER FEMUR the last possible second. A strange sight indeed: a one-legged man, clinging to a metal leg, attached to a rope, 3,000 feet in the air. Will starts pulling with everything he's got. A dead-hang rope climb. The weight of this undulating action causes

dialogues.speaker: THE MARBLE PEDESTAL
dialogues.text: to strain against the window transom, inching closer and closer to dislodging completely.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: free-climbs for all he's worth, hand-over-hand, a man of undying determination: his arms burning, but his eyes focused on the open window ledge ten feet above him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the control panel for the doors, Zhao has used his smartphone to hack bypass the fire alarm function and he instructs the doors to reset. Zhao jabs the "SECURE DOORS" button the panel and watches the titanium Goliaths lurch toward each other. Zhao takes cover behind a LOW CABINET, checking his mini- Beretta, ready to plug anyone who comes through the door.  99.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will's forearm slaps over the marble pedestal. He pulls himself up and over the final hurdle. Exhausted, Will collapses. But only for a moment as he suddenly sees the penthouse doors closing -- he's only go seconds before they shut again, sealing him out for good. Leaping into action, Will starts pulling up the rope, his prosthesis dangling on the other end like fish on a hook. Just then, another explosion from below rocks the penthou floor causing the marble pedestal to break free and plumm through the window like an anchor. The cord rips through Will's duct-taped hands, smoking th as Will's prosthesis whips back to him like a boomerang. Will clutches his leg as it's being pulled from his grip the four-hundred pound pedestal on other end of the rope. Will glances back at the penthouse doors -- they're almos closed now: he's gotta make a choice his leg or the door. But Will makes a third play: he pulls the statue's sword from his waistband and cuts the rope with one downward ha The rope whips through the window opening as Will tumbles back, his prosthetic leg in his hand. Will jams his leg into the PROSTHETIC SLEEVE and spins to see the penthouse doors a foot from sealing shut. Will bolts for them, diving into a head-first slide on hi side -- like a car up on two wheels -- and narrowly SKIMS THROUGH THE OPENING. He made it. Only, he didn't. Will's PROSTHETIC ANKLE is caught in the door like a bear trap. Will tugs on it with both hands, it won't budge. With one final pull, Will yanks his leg through the doors which quickly seal shut behind him, tumbling back into a heap on the foyer. Then:

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Don't move. Will looks up to see Zhao pointing his tiny Beretta a foo from Will's nose. Will's shoulders slump at his luck. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: You're too close. What an odd thing to say. Zhao doesn't follow...

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: You're...

dialogues.speaker: WHACK
dialogues.text: With cat-like quickness, Will slaps the Beretta out of th inexperienced billionaire's hands as he yanks Zhao's wris downward and simultaneously sweeps his leg, dropping him the polished floor -- a slick-ass take down. WILL (cont'd) ...too close. Will pounces on him, driving the point of his good knee between Zhao's shoulder-blades, pinning him there. WILL (cont'd) We need to talk.

dialogues.speaker: A SMALL MAN IN A SHARP SUIT.
dialogues.text: Tan, salt & pepper hair. Bushy eyebrows. Capped teeth. A Chinese Martin Scorsese. This is WU-SAI JUN, kingpin and crime lord of Hong Kong. He smiles at us.

dialogues.speaker: WU-SAI JUN
dialogues.text: I know this is difficult. We're...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Opulent, dark. The den of a powerful man. Zhao sits oppos Jun. Xia sprawls on a nearby chaise as Feng looms in view Behind Jun, the most striking feature: a wall comprised o GLASS TERRARIUMS, each containing a solitary SNAKE.

dialogues.speaker: WU-SAI JUN
dialogues.text: For a man like you, this must come with some discomfort. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: WU-SAI JUN (cont'd) But you can take solace in the fact that it's all for a greater good. The glory of The Middle Kingdom.

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: Forgive me, but I don't see how extortion glorifies China.

dialogues.speaker: WU-SAI JUN
dialogues.text: This isn't extortion, Mr. Zhao, this is business.

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: And if I refuse? Wu-Sai Jun smiles. This man might take more convincing. H rises from this seat moving toward the back wall of snake

dialogues.speaker: WU-SAI JUN
dialogues.text: There are ten snakes in the world to which there exists no known antivenom. (re: the terrarium wall) I've made a home here for each one. Jun slides out one particular terrarium from the wall lik drawer in a bureau. The BLACK & BLUE STRIPED SNAKE inside it coils, ready to strike. WU-SAI JUN (cont'd) The snake handlers of Burma practice an ancient art called Mithridatism. He opens the top of glass box. The snake hisses, a warnin WU-SAI JUN (cont'd) They believed that by ingesting small amounts of a snake's poison over time, they would become one with the animal, rendering its venom harmless. Jun rolls up his sleeve, revealing his BLACK LOTUS TRIAD TATTOO. He places his arm in the terrarium, holding it there in front of the hissing reptile but never taking hi eyes from Zhao. WU-SAI JUN (cont'd) The Blue Krait's venom has been used for centuries by indigenous Malaysian tribes to hunt big game. It's said a single bite can stop an elephant's heart in under ninety seconds. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Suddenly Jun throws his fingers out, splaying them in a sharp motion that causes the snake to strike -- biting Ju on his forearm, just under his tattoo. The gangster winces but doesn't waver -- watching Zhao th entire time. The snake recoils. Jun lifts his arm out of the terrarium and observes two trickles of blood running down his forea Pointedly, he licks the blood from his arm and then, gent as you please, rolls his shirt sleeve back, buttoning it. WU-SAI JUN (cont'd) I know this arrangement may seem poisonous to you now but, over time, once you've completed your building, I promise you: you won't feel a thing. Zhao looks pained. A moment, then...

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: Give me the account number. Jun nods to Xia. She slides over a piece of paper with a lengthy number on it. Zhao takes it and enters the info into his phone. By the looks of things, he's transferring $50 million from his account into a different one. He hits transfer. His phone chimes: complete. ZHAO (cont'd) Are we done? Jun gives us a reptilian smile.

dialogues.speaker: WU-SAI JUN
dialogues.text: Good luck with construction. Zhao stands, straightens his jacket and exits.

dialogues.speaker: WILL, (PRE-LAP)
dialogues.text: You paid them off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zhao sits on a couch as Will looms above him.

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: If I didn't, they would've crippled my labor force and cost me triple that amount in construction delays. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: So you caved. But if he got what he wanted, why's he doing all this?

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: I didn't cave. I could never let The Pearl become corrupted by the likes of Wu-Sai Jun. (beat) As soon as he accepted my payment, he chopped it up, dispersing it to all of his other off-shore accounts in smaller increments.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: He laundered it.

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: Essentially, yes. But what he didn't know is that I hid a Trojan Horse in my wire transfer -- a digital dye pack that infected every account any portion of my payment touched, feeding the routing and account information back to me. Zhao holds up the RED MEMORY CARD. ZHAO (cont'd) This card contains the account information for every single dollar Wu-Sai Jun and the Black Lotus Triads have. Over half a billion dollars in illicit monies in thirty-six separate holding banks around the globe. (beat) I hand this over to the Chinese government and they can freeze all of his assets -- destroying his entire operation and sending him to prison for the rest of his life. (beat) This card IS their operation. And they'll stop at nothing to get it back.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Follow the money.

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: Indeed. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Then why didn't you turn it over to the authorities? Be done with it.

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: If I did that, Wu-Sai Jun would have no reason not to kill me. I'd be signing my own death warrant. (beat) As long as I hold onto this, we have detente. They had to leave me alone and let me build The Pearl without interference.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: But how does getting that particular card help them -- you must've made copies.

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: I did, of course. But this is the original. With it, they can reverse engineer my Trojan Horse payment and scrub their accounts clean again -- no digital dye, no way for the authorities to trace the money and find their secret accounts. If they get their hands on this, all of my other copies would be worthless. (beat) Besides, their plan isn't to let me live. Their plan is to get their hands on this and the moment they do, I'm a dead man. Will paces, putting it all together now... Will stands.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: So they lit the building on fire because they knew you'd grab the most valuable thing in the world to you and flee -- just like anyone would.

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: No one could get it out of my safe except for me. They just needed to give me a good reason. ZHAO (cont'd) Where are you going? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zhao Will wall. Zhao 105. (3)

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: We're gonna give them what they came here for.

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: Didn't you hear me? As soon as they have it, they'll kill me. They'll kill us both.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Maybe. But they have my daughter and that's all that matters to me.

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: I'm not eager to die.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: In ten minutes this entire floor is gonna be on fire, so the way I see it, you can either stay here and die or come with me and have a chance to live. weighs the offer, he knows Will isn't wrong.

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: What's your plan? glances at the ceremonial CHINESE SWORD mounted on the He turns back to Zhao.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: You got any duct tape? eyes the American suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tallest building in the world burns. In epic grand finale fashion, we circle the building landing on:

dialogues.speaker: THE GLASS OBSERVATION DECK
dialogues.text: The light from the flames below dance off of its facets, making it sparkle against the skyline like a black diamon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce and his THREE MEN wait inside the CANOPIED GLASS, each strapped into a sleek, low-profile, PARACHUTE PACKS. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Georgia, her Panda hoodie dirt-stained, sits on the groun eyes red from crying. Suddenly, she sees something...

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIA
dialogues.text: Daddy! Pierce and his men turn to see Will pushing Zhao forward like a prisoner, his wrists duct taped together in front him. Pierce grabs Georgia roughly, yanking the girl to her fee his men fan out. Will and Zhao stop twenty feet from them

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: See? I knew you'd find a way. Pierce nods at his biggest guy. PIERCE (cont'd) Check 'em. The BIG MAN moves to Will and starts patting him down. He gets to Will's leg -- feels something funny. Will pulls u his pant-leg to reveal his metal prosthesis. Will shrugs. The Big Man moves on to Zhao, patting him do as the billionaire lifts his duct-taped hands above his h

dialogues.speaker: BIG MAN
dialogues.text: They're clean. The Big Man returns to his post. Pierce nods his approval

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Smart. Will holds up the RED MEMORY CARD.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Here it is. Now let her go.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Go to your daddy, sweetheart. Georgia starts for Will, but Pierce stops her short -- grabbing her by the hoodie, toying with Will. PIERCE (cont'd) You know -- on second thought -- I'd like to have that memory card first. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Will's about to toss it to him when suddenly ZHAO LIFTS H

dialogues.speaker: DUCT TAPED WRISTS, REVEALING THAT HE'S BEEN PALMING HIS
dialogues.text: BERETTA NANO -- hiding it beneath the silvery tape.

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: I can't let you do it. Will blanches. Zhao has double crossed him. Pierce and hi men lift their weapons as Zhao snatches the memory card o of Will's hand and steps behind him for cover.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing? This isn't the plan.

dialogues.speaker: ZHAO
dialogues.text: The plan's changed. (to Pierce) I want a parachute. Pierce grabs Georgia, jamming his gun against her cheek. ZHAO (cont'd) I don't care about the girl -- a parachute or your boss gets nothing. Will's jaw sets -- the tension high. Pierce calculates th angles, then turns to his BALD GOON.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Give him your parachute.
